Posizione:

Inclusyon √® la societ√† di ricerca e selezione specializzata nel recruiting di personale qualificato appartenente alle categorie protette.

Il contesto:

Per importante azienda leader nel settore Fintech, Inclusyon ricerca un/a Data Scientist - categorie protette Legge 68/99.

Il ruolo:


Ricercare, progettare e implementare algoritmi di apprendimento automatico appropriati.
Selezione di set di dati e metodi di rappresentazione dei dati appropriati.
Esecuzione di test di apprendimento automatico, esperimenti ed esecuzione di analisi statistiche.
Presentare in modo chiaro e conciso risultati complessi utilizzando visualizzazioni di dati intuitive e belle.
Estensione delle librerie e dei framework AI/ML esistenti.
Essere sempre aggiornati sugli ultimi sviluppi e sulle innovazioni nel settore.
Lavorare senza problemi come parte del team di ricerca e sviluppo e collaborare con diverse funzioni aziendali durante l'intero ciclo di vita dei progetti.


Requisiti:

Requisiti primari:


Laurea magistrale o dottorato in Ingegneria, Informatica, Statistica, Fisica, Matematica o campi tecnici correlati.
Esperienza lavorativa pregressa in un'industria, universit√† o laboratorio governativo, in un ruolo con enfasi primaria sulla ricerca sull'intelligenza artificiliale.
Ottime competenze nella modellazione statistica e nell'apprendimento automatico, in particolare tecniche quali bagging, random forests, gradient boosting, tecniche di ottimizzazione degli iperparametri, modelli bayesiani, reti neurali, analisi delle serie temporali, elaborazione dei segnali, ecc.
Esperienza di codifica rilevante in linguaggi di programmazione come Python (o equivalenti).
Eccellenti capacit√† di lavoro di squadra.
Creativit√† e capacit√† di formulare problemi e risolverli sia in team che in autonomia.
Disponibilit√† a lavorare per raggiungere obiettivi di ricerca ambiziosi a lungo termine, identificando al contempo traguardi intermedi e rispettando le scadenze.
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.


Requisiti secondari:


Conoscenza del funzionamento dei mercati finanziari.
Conoscenza del framework JAVA e Spring.
Competenza in SQL.
Conoscenza dei sistemi di controllo delle versioni (GIT).
Conoscenza di AWS.
Interesse per strumenti e framework Big Data come Apache Spark.


Altre informazioni:

Sede di lavoro: Milano (MI)

Modalit√† di lavoro: ibrida

Orario di lavoro: 09.00 - 18.00.

Title: Software Engineer for AI Training Data (JavaScript/Swift)
Description:
Tech Stack

It does not matter which programming language is your primary and we accept engineers with JavaScript (however, you must be willing to work using Swift). Previous Swift experience is not required and we provide basic training.

Accepted Locations

We are accepting applicants from the US, Canada, and most countries in LATAM and Europe. We are accepting some countries in Africa and Asia. For the full list of accepted locations, click here. This work is 100% remote.

Loom Video

Our Founder/CEO, Gabe Greenberg, created a more in depth Loom video that we highly recommend you watch! Check it out here: https://www.loom.com/share/5a8972c7fbbf46aaa3f389b2b6391c40

Job Overview

We are currently seeking Developers for project-specific roles focused on RLHF. This role will play a key part in our reinforcement learning from human feedback (RLHF) initiatives, contributing to cutting-edge projects.

You‚Äôll join an expert annotation team to create training data for for the worlds most advanced AI models. No previous AI experience is necessary. You'll get your foot in the door with one of the biggest players in the AI/LLM space today. We are seeking software engineers with 4+ years of experience to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. We currently have 200+ roles open!

What Will I Be Doing?


Evaluating the quality of AI-generated code, including human-readable summaries of your rationale
Solve coding problems, writing functional and efficient code
Writing robust test cases to confirm code works efficiently and effectively
We asked the technical project manager to go into even more detail and this is how he answered: It is solving coding challenges, creating instructions to help others, reviewing the code before it goes into the model, and there's a ton of variety in the projects. We have everything from "which piece of Python code is better?" to "make a full mobile application using this chatbot, and improve the chatbot's responses afterwards to make it faster"


Contract Length


This project is expected to last until the end of September and you'll be able to continue to work on other projects (though likely not in Swift).
You can end the contract at any time.


Flexible Schedules


Developers can set their own hours - ideal candidates will be interested in spending 15+ hours a week. They will be with teams, so strong performers will adapt to the urgency of projects and stay engaged, but incredibly flexible on working hours.
Take a 3 hour lunch, no problem. You are paid according to time spent on the platform, which is calculated in the coding exercises, as opposed to tracking your own hours.


Compensation


US: $50 /hr
Brazil: $28.70/hr
Egypt: $22.05/hr
Phillipines: $25.55/hr
All other countries: $35/hr
Expectations are 15+ hours per week however there is no upper limit. We have engineers working 20-40 hrs per week and some that are working 40+ hours per week. You can work as much as you want to. You'll get paid on a weekly basis. You get paid per hour of work done on the platform.


Interview Process

We've created a 3.5 hour screening and onboarding process to join as a Software Engineer for AI Training Data which can be accomplished in 1 week or less. We purposely perform most of these steps asynchronously because most of the RLHF work is async and self guided. After you apply, if you look like a good fit we'll provide you access to the G2i dashboard to go through this simple screening process.

Step 1: Learn in depth about the role (35 min)

Step 2: Perform a simple RLHF code review (35 min)

Step 3: Receive platform credentials, pass ID verification (5 min), and choose your project (30 min).

Step 4: Perform a production level RLHF task (75 min) "aka the final interview"

Join us: Based on your final interview, you'll will put you on the right difficulty RLHF project

Title: Software Control Engineer
Description:
Gruppo Multinazionale, leader mondiale nella progettazione e costruzione di carrelli elevatori per la movimentazione merci col marchio Hyster e Yale, 6.000 dipendenti in tutto il mondo, ricerca per la propria sede italiana di Milano:




Control and Software Engineer




Descrizione della posizione: La figura ricercata parteciper√† attivamente allo sviluppo di nuovi veicoli elettrici Warehouse, dalla fase di design fino all‚Äôinnovazione in ambito produttivo. In particolare si occuper√† di:




Gestione in autonomia di progetti di integrazione di sistemi Hardware e Software per il controllo di veicoli elettrici con pilota o automatici
Sviluppo e verifica sistemi di controllo embedded tramite Matlab/Simulink e programmazione C
Sviluppo di soluzioni innovative funzionali alla realizzazione di macchine automatiche (e.g. Machine learning, embedded AI, Machine vision)
Sviluppo di sistemi di data mining per predictive maintenance e performance optimization
Gestione degli sviluppi congiunti con i fornitori onde garantire le performance richieste.




Requisiti richiesti:




Laurea in Ing. Informatica, Automazione o Elettronica con esperienza di programmazione e sviluppo SW
Conoscenza di sistemi di programmazione embedded e per PC (linguaggio C o equivalente)
Gradita esperienza di sviluppo sistemi di controllo tramite Matlab/Simulink
Gradita esperienza lavorativa (1-2 anni) nello sviluppo di Sistemi di Controllo embedded in ambito Automotive o Veicoli Elettrici (Preferibilmente nel settore material handling)
Gradita esperienza e interesse verso Machine learning, Data mining e automazione

HTML:
Gruppo Multinazionale, leader mondiale nella progettazione e costruzione di carrelli elevatori per la movimentazione merci col marchio Hyster e Yale, 6.000 dipendenti in tutto il mondo, ricerca per la propria sede italiana di Milano:


Control and Software Engineer


Descrizione della posizione: La figura ricercata parteciper√† attivamente allo sviluppo di nuovi veicoli elettrici Warehouse, dalla fase di design fino all‚Äôinnovazione in ambito produttivo. In particolare si occuper√† di:


  • Gestione in autonomia di progetti di integrazione di sistemi Hardware e Software per il controllo di veicoli elettrici con pilota o automatici
  • Sviluppo e verifica sistemi di controllo embedded tramite Matlab/Simulink e programmazione C
  • Sviluppo di soluzioni innovative funzionali alla realizzazione di macchine automatiche (e.g. Machine learning, embedded AI, Machine vision)
  • Sviluppo di sistemi di data mining per predictive maintenance e performance optimization
  • Gestione degli sviluppi congiunti con i fornitori onde garantire le performance richieste.


Requisiti richiesti:


  • Laurea in Ing. Informatica, Automazione o Elettronica con esperienza di programmazione e sviluppo SW
  • Conoscenza di sistemi di programmazione embedded e per PC (linguaggio C o equivalente)
  • Gradita esperienza di sviluppo sistemi di controllo tramite Matlab/Simulink
  • Gradita esperienza lavorativa (1-2 anni) nello sviluppo di Sistemi di Controllo embedded in ambito Automotive o Veicoli Elettrici (Preferibilmente nel settore material handling)

  • Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese scritta e parlata

  • Spiccate capacit√† di lavoro di gruppo in ambito sia locale che internazionale.

Title: Junior Software Developer
HTML:
MainStreaming¬Æ is an intelligent media delivery company that empowers enterprises, media and gaming companies to ensure the best Quality of Experience to their audience, through its revolutionary AI-powered technology.

It optimizes the viewing experience with its Intelligent Media Deliver Platform (iMDP), the first platform designed to guarantee full governance over the streaming process, the highest Quality of Service and the best Return on Investment.

For our brand-new office located in Milano Bicocca we are looking for a:


JUNIOR SOFTWARE DEVELOPER


Job Description:

MainStreaming is in a scaling phase; our team is going to expands internationally and the heart of our product the R&D team is looking for new talents to join us. In order to improve everyday our platform, we are looking for a talented Junior Software Developer who helps us on tons of new projects like web portals and web applications for the management of media contents (media player, media manager) and also for the CDN side configuration.


Key Responsibilities:

  • You will participate in the design and development of software applications dedicated for the video streaming by collaborating closely with multi-disciplinary teams;
  • Be responsible for the code performance;
  • Develop and manage internal and public web applications;
  • You will propose, evaluate and adopt new technologies to maximize the efficiency of development;
  • Deliver testable, maintainable and high-quality code and take operational responsibility for the components that you develop.


What We're Looking for:

  • PASSION FOR THE PRODUCT: Professional attitude towards software craftsmanship including testing and a passion for writing good documentation.
  • PROACTIVITY: You are confident enough to self-start your project and set your priority in autonomy while working with a group of international peers.
  • EAGERNESS TO LEARN: You don't get scared of something new, we provide you an environment where you can improve every day.
  • TEAMWORK: A high degree of collaboration, we are a team, we develop and grow together.
  • ENGLISH: Conversational level, you will share your time within an international Team.

Skills:

  • Previous programming experience with at least one of the following programming languages: C#, java, python;
  • Basic knowledge ofJavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, SASS, and LESS;
  • Basic knowledge ofJS tools: NodeJS, npm, Automation tools (Webpack/Lint);
  • Basic knowledge of version control systems:GIT;
  • Interest in develop skills with one of modern JS Framework (Angular, React, VueJS);
  • Basic experience withUnit Testing, Test Driven development.


What we offer:

  • A young, dynamic and entrepreneurial environment where to develop and growth;
  • An innovative technology and service able to support the transition from traditional broadcasting to the streaming entertainment of the future;
  • A growth path aimed at improving your professionalism;
  • Flexible working hours;
  • Breakfast, lunch and snacks in our office;
  • Access to E-Learning platform;
  • Health Insurance.


Salary and benefits will be assessed in relation to the candidate's experience and skills


In MainStreaming you will be part of a dynamic, flexible, young, tight-knit and international environment and will have the chance to work in a company that values innovation, out of the box thinking, its employees and committed in making the world a better place.


MainStreaming is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Title: Senior AI Engineer
Description:
SENIOR AI ENGINEER

Entra nel nostro mondo.

Trasforma insieme a noi.

Quale sar√† la tua sfida?

Il nostro team di Artificial Intelligence Engineering si impegna a supportare i clienti nel percorso di adozione dell‚Äôintelligenza artificiale attraverso la realizzazione di factory di soluzioni di AI, azionabili e integrate nell'architettura e nei processi aziendali.

La figura dell‚ÄôAI Engineer progetta soluzioni software di Machine Learning (ML) scalabili per i casi d'uso dei clienti e le industrializza per l‚Äôesecuzione in produzione garantendo i livelli richiesti di performance, sicurezza e governabilit√†.

L‚ÄôAI Engineer lavora a stretto contatto con altre figure di Bip xTech, come Cloud Data Architect, Data Scientist e Data Engineer, per realizzare soluzioni AI di alta qualit√† sotto ogni aspetto, disegnando e implementando: piattaforme MLOps, architetture dati e AI, modelli di AI, applicazioni e altro ancora.

L‚ÄôAI Engineer inoltre contribuir√† alla Bip xTech Data Community con attivit√† di ricerca, scouting tecnologico, concept di nuove soluzioni e sviluppo del business sui clienti di BIP.

Sarai tu a entrare nel nostro team?¬†

Requisiti fondamentali


Laurea specialistica in Ingegneria Informatica, Data Science, Informatica o discipline affini (STEM).
Esperienza pregressa di almeno 5 anni nello sviluppo di software in almeno un linguaggio, come per esempio: Python, Scala, e/o simili.
Esperienza nel disegno di soluzioni software e nell‚Äôimplementazione di strutture dati, algoritmi.
Esperienza nell‚Äôutilizzo degli strumenti di Code Repository e CI/CD.
Conoscenza di framework di versionamento di dati e/o modelli (esempio: MLFlow, DVC, WanDB‚Ä¶).
Conoscenza dei concetti, algoritmi e metodologie di Machine Learning e Gen AI.
Esperienza con linguaggi SQL per il design, query e gestione dei database; esperienza nell‚Äôutilizzo di linguaggi SQL per le attivit√† di ETL;
Esperienza in attivit√† di coordinamento e crescita di un team o pi√π team di progetto, pre-sales e delivery;
Indispensabile la conoscenza fluente di italiano e inglese professionali.


Plus


Esperienza nell‚Äôutilizzo delle principali piattaforme cloud (esempio: Google, AWS, Azure) e relativi servizi di Cloud Foundation, Data Platform e AI.
Esperienza con tecniche di allenamento e fine-tuning di reti neurali (esempio: superconvergenza, PEFT, LORA‚Ä¶).
Conoscenza di tecniche di semi-supervised e self-supervised learning.
Esperienza con framework di lavoro AGILE (esempio: Scrum, Kanban).


Soft Skills:


Standing consulenziale
Spiccate doti comunicative e interpersonali
Capacit√† di collaborazione in team
Flessibilit√† e stress tolerance nel rispetto delle scadenze
Disponibilit√† di trasferte in Italia o all‚Äôestero


Perch√® Bip?

People at¬†the¬†center of our culture

Fiducia e collaborazione, imprenditorialit√† e coraggio, meritocrazia e sviluppo guidano la crescita delle nostre persone.

Lavorare in BIP √® un'esperienza sfidante, in cui il merito paga e l'innovazione avviene attraverso idee coraggiose, collaborazione e un rapporto di fiducia con i nostri clienti.¬†

Challenge yourself

Avrai la possibilit√† di metterti alla prova in contesti progettuali diversi in termini di ambito, natura delle attivit√† e stakeholders coinvolti. Vedrai valorizzato il tuo spirito di iniziativa, la tua passione, l‚Äôautonomia e la capacit√† di assumerti responsabilit√† e metterti in gioco.

Unlocking your potential

Potrai partecipare a + di 300 corsi formativi all‚Äôavanguardia per accrescere le tue competenze su tecnologie e temi di business emergenti.

Work-life Integration

Troverai una policy che supporta lo smartworking¬†fino al 100% del proprio tempo e favorisce il work-life integration.

Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

Valorizziamo l‚Äôunicit√† e ci impegniamo a garantire che tutti abbiano pari opportunit√† di dare un contributo ed esprimere al massimo il potenziale nell'ambiente di lavoro.

Il nostro approccio alla diversit√† e all‚Äôinclusione si fonda sui principi di etica e integrit√† e rappresenta il fattore determinante per lo sviluppo di orizzonti, di crescita personale e aziendale, pi√π ampi.

Promuoviamo l‚Äôinserimento e l‚Äôintegrazione lavorativa delle persone appartenenti alle categorie protette ‚Äì in base a quanto disciplinato dalla legge 68/99 ‚Äì.

Next Steps

Una volta ricevuto il tuo cv ci prenderemo del tempo per valutarlo attentamente.

Se c‚Äô√® un match con questa o con altre posizioni aperte all‚Äôinterno del Gruppo, ti contatteremo per iniziare la nostra conoscenza reciproca.

L‚Äôiter di selezione comprende generalmente un colloquio con HR, un colloquio tecnico con un line manager ed un eventuale colloquio con un Partner.

L‚Äôordine e il numero delle interviste potrebbero variare a seconda delle esigenze di recruiting.

In alternativa, saremo felici di conservare il tuo CV nel nostro database per poterlo rivalutare per altre opportunit√† future.

Se dovessi identificare ulteriori posizioni di tuo interesse ed in linea con il tuo profilo, aspettiamo la tua candidatura per poterla valutare nuovamente.

Su di Noi

Nati nel 2003, abbiamo raccolto e valorizzato l‚Äôesperienza storica della consulenza e abbiamo aggiunto due ingredienti chiave: l‚Äôinnovazione e la digitalizzazione.

Grazie a questo percorso siamo oggi oltre 5000 professionisti e professioniste, presenti in 13 Paesi, con oltre 4500 progetti alle spalle e le conoscenze pi√π all‚Äôavanguardia nell'ambito della Digital Transformation, Data Science, Cybersecurity, Industry 4.0, IOT e di tutte le Disruptive Technologies che mettiamo a servizio di ogni settore di mercato.

Aiutiamo i nostri clienti a fare la differenza creando qualit√† su larga scala attraverso una formula che opera su tre leve: Valore, Persone e Tecnologia.

Crediamo nel valore dell‚Äôeccellenza, che √® la bussola su cui orientiamo il nostro agire, e adottiamo un approccio etico e leale nei confronti di quante e quanti scelgono di¬†lavorare con noi, promuovendo un ambiente in cui le persone possano crescere insieme, grazie alla contaminazione tra competenze diverse.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
The Company:




Exsolv√¶ is a data consultancy based in Brussels, Belgium. We are dedicated to fostering a culture of knowledge sharing among data professionals.

Our goal is not only to excel in one discipline, but also to gain a comprehensive understanding of the challenges spread across the four pillars of our expertise:




Data Foundations: Data Engineering to Design, develop, and maintain data architecture and infrastructure, build data pipelines, etc.
BI, Data Analytics & Visualization: Design and implement data visualization solutions that enable to gain insights from the data.
Data Science & Artificial Intelligence: Implement & Develop algorithms in Deep Learning, Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence.
Data Governance & Strategy: Strategic consultancy for acquisition and valorization of Data.




We provide a collaborative ecosystem for a new generation of pluri-disciplinary engineers who are eager to broaden their understanding of challenges across the data flow.




As a Solver in Data Science at Exsolv√¶, you will be responsible for providing data-driven solutions to our clients' challenges in industries such as banking, insurance, and pharmaceutical manufacturing, ...




Job Responsibilities:




Analyzing complex data sets and extracting insights to inform decision making using software such as Python, R, and SQL.
Designing and implementing data-driven solutions using statistical and machine learning techniques.
Collaborating with clients to understand their needs and challenges, and providing recommendations.
Communicating findings and recommendations to clients in a clear and concise manner.
Continuously learning and staying up-to-date with the latest developments in the field of Data Science.
Mentoring junior team members and contributing to the development of the Data Science team.







Key Requirements:




A Master's or PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field.
Strong experience in data analysis and machine learning techniques.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Proactive and able to work independently as well as part of a team.
A strong desire to learn and stay up-to-date with the latest developments in Data Science.
Fluent in English (Mandatory).
Fluency in Flemish and/or French (Mandatory).







Additional Preferred Qualifications:




Programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL.
Data visualization tools such as Tableau and Matplotlib.
Hands on experience with Large Language Models and associated frameworks (OpenAI, Llamas, Langchain, ...)
Machine learning libraries and frameworks such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, and PyTorch.
Cloud computing platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud, and Azure.
Data storage and management systems such as Hadoop, Spark, and NoSQL databases.
Collaboration and project management tools such as Jupyter and GitHub.







Advantages of the Position:




Long Term Contract (CDI)
The opportunity to work on a wide range of challenging and diverse projects in industries such as banking, insurance, and pharmaceutical manufacturing.
A collaborative and supportive work environment.
Continuous learning and professional development opportunities.
Attractive salary and benefits package.
The chance to be part of a meaningful project from the start.

HTML:
The Company:


Exsolv√¶ is a data consultancy based in Brussels, Belgium. We are dedicated to fostering a culture of knowledge sharing among data professionals.

Our goal is not only to excel in one discipline, but also to gain a comprehensive understanding of the challenges spread across the four pillars of our expertise:


  1. Data Foundations: Data Engineering to Design, develop, and maintain data architecture and infrastructure, build data pipelines, etc.
  2. BI, Data Analytics & Visualization: Design and implement data visualization solutions that enable to gain insights from the data.
  3. Data Science & Artificial Intelligence: Implement & Develop algorithms in Deep Learning, Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence.
  4. Data Governance & Strategy: Strategic consultancy for acquisition and valorization of Data.


We provide a collaborative ecosystem for a new generation of pluri-disciplinary engineers who are eager to broaden their understanding of challenges across the data flow.


As a Solver in Data Science at Exsolv√¶, you will be responsible for providing data-driven solutions to our clients' challenges in industries such as banking, insurance, and pharmaceutical manufacturing, ...


Job Responsibilities:


  • Analyzing complex data sets and extracting insights to inform decision making using software such as Python, R, and SQL.
  • Designing and implementing data-driven solutions using statistical and machine learning techniques.
  • Collaborating with clients to understand their needs and challenges, and providing recommendations.
  • Communicating findings and recommendations to clients in a clear and concise manner.
  • Continuously learning and staying up-to-date with the latest developments in the field of Data Science.
  • Mentoring junior team members and contributing to the development of the Data Science team.



Key Requirements:


  • A Master's or PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • Strong experience in data analysis and machine learning techniques.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Proactive and able to work independently as well as part of a team.
  • A strong desire to learn and stay up-to-date with the latest developments in Data Science.
  • Fluent in English (Mandatory).
  • Fluency in Flemish and/or French (Mandatory).



Additional Preferred Qualifications:


  • Programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL.
  • Data visualization tools such as Tableau and Matplotlib.
  • Hands on experience with Large Language Models and associated frameworks (OpenAI, Llamas, Langchain, ...)
  • Machine learning libraries and frameworks such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, and PyTorch.
  • Cloud computing platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud, and Azure.
  • Data storage and management systems such as Hadoop, Spark, and NoSQL databases.
  • Collaboration and project management tools such as Jupyter and GitHub.



Advantages of the Position:


  • Long Term Contract (CDI)
  • The opportunity to work on a wide range of challenging and diverse projects in industries such as banking, insurance, and pharmaceutical manufacturing.
  • A collaborative and supportive work environment.
  • Continuous learning and professional development opportunities.
  • Attractive salary and benefits package.
  • The chance to be part of a meaningful project from the start.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer F/M/X
Description:
We are currently seeking a Machine Learning Engineer to join our dynamic team at Amaris Consulting, located in Belgium. This role is a unique opportunity for those passionate about AI and machine learning, looking to apply their skills in a challenging yet rewarding environment.

üî•Your Responsibilities:

Developing machine learning models from scratch and improving existing ones
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and provide appropriate solutions.
Data preprocessing including data cleaning, normalization, and transformation.
Evaluating model performance using suitable metrics and validation techniques
Maintaining clear documentation of the development process for future reference and audits
Staying updated with the latest trends in machine learning algorithms, tools, industry best practices
Promoting knowledge sharing within the team through presentations or workshops on new findings or technologies related to ML/AI
Troubleshooting any issues that arise during the development or deployment of ML models

üéØ Your Profile:

The ideal candidate is a recent graduate who has a strong passion for artificial intelligence (AI) & machine learning (ML). You should be eager to learn new things continuously while being able to work effectively as part of a diverse team.

A bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science/engineering/mathematics or related field is required; a masters degree is advantageous.
Familiarity with Python programming language along with libraries such as TensorFlow/Keras/PyTorch used in ML applications.
An understanding of various Machine Learning algorithms like Regression Models, Decision Trees etc., along with their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
Good understanding of data structures, data modeling and software architecture
An analytical mindset with problem-solving skills.
Ability to troubleshoot complex software issues
Excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with team members and stakeholders
Able to work independently as well as in a team environment.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and French or Dutch.
Minimum 1 to 7 years of experience.




üöÄ Advantages:

An international learning environment
Extensive training and certifications.
A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.

üí° We are an independent company that values:

Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.




Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Title: Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
APPLICATION BY EMAIL according to the application rules hereunder (not via LinkedIn). Please attach all the documents asked.




About the project

On the battlefield, injured soldiers can face significant delays in medical treatment or evacuation due to ongoing hostilities and treacherous terrain. Traditional methods of casualty care rely on limited information and may put medics at unnecessary risk: medics often lack a comprehensive picture of the battlefield, hindering their ability to locate and prioritise casualties while minimising exposure to threats. The TaMaCare project emerges from this critical observation, aiming to revolutionise battlefield casualty care by creating a real-time digital twin of the frontline. More precisely, we aim to improve response times and decision-making in critical situations. The proposed digital twin aims to provide medics with a clear view of the battlefield, encompassing the location of injured soldiers, their vital signs, and any structures or potential dangers present in the vicinity.




Expected results

The impact of TaMaCare on battlefield casualty care is multifaceted and far-reaching:

Faster and better decision making: TaMaCare will create a digital twin of the battlefield for use by the rear echelon and decision makers, allowing faster response times and improved decision-making. The digital twin will provide real-time information of the environment, casualty location and their health status, allowing medics to make informed decisions about treatment priorities and evacuation routes, considering factors like urgency, (environmental) hazards, and resource availability. The detailed 3D map, including casualties and threats, can also be used to plan optimal evacuation routes, taking into account terrain, obstacles, and the physical condition of casualties.
Reduced risk for soldiers and medics: The digital twin will be created using unmanned systems, i.e. without putting soldiers in harm‚Äôs way. By providing a clear picture of potential threats, TaMaCare allows medics to navigate the battlefield with greater awareness and minimise their exposure to danger.
Post-action analysis: The digital twin allows for an after action analysis of the decision and actions that were made, allowing to draw lessons for future interventions.

The benefits of TaMaCare extend beyond immediate casualty care and contribute to a broader strengthening of defence capabilities. In fact, the project fosters advancements in 3D mapping, threat detection/assessment through image processing, and Ultra-Wide Band (UWB) localization networks. These advancements have broader applications for military and civilian operations and for intelligence gathering: planning for offensive/defensive operations, re-assessment of the geometrical environment after man-made or natural calamities, improved navigation of unmanned vehicles, removal of UXO/IED (Unexploded Ordnance/Improvised Explosive Devices), etc.




Your role

The research in TaMaCare will be performed by a Belgian consortium. The role of the researcher hired for this job offer will focus on the development of AI models and ML techniques to facilitate, automate and simplify detection of threats on the battlefield using electromagnetic (panchromatic, multispectral or hyperspectral) sensors in the visible and infrared spectrum based on their spatial or spatio-spectral signature. This knowledge will also be applied to other projects within RMA with similar needs.




Required skills

Technical skills

The applicant shall have a Master Degree in Engineering Science, Applied Sciences, Civil Engineering, Physics, Computer Science or Mathematics.

Training or experience in Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and/or Deep Learning is essential;
Experience in programming with C++ or Python is essential;
Experience with OpenCV, PyTorch or Tensorflow is highly recommended;
Experience with Computer Vision is highly recommended;
Experience with the Robotic Operating System (ROS) or Linux is recommended;
Training or experience in multi- or hyperspectral imaging or other EO technologies is an added value;
Training or experience in processing of large scale data is an added value;
Training or experience in agile workflow methodologies is an added value;
Training or experience in applied, collaborative research is an added value;

Other skills

The applicant shall have very good knowledge of English (oral / written).
The applicant shall preferably have knowledge of either French or Dutch and a minimum knowledge of the other language in order to allow collaboration with peers. This will be tested during the selection process.

Specific requirements

Interest in starting a PhD is an added value.
The researcher may be exposed to classified information and will therefore have to obtain the required security clearance. The candidate must consent with the background check required to obtain this clearance, which will be executed by the Belgian Defence.
A driver‚Äôs licence valid in Belgium is an added value.
Working for the Patrimony requires living in Belgium for the duration of the study.




Application

You will be working in a military environment. That is why everyone is expected to undergo a security verification. A passport issued by a country that is both member of the EU and NATO is required. Please add to your application the filled-out document. The form can be downloaded from:

http://www.rma.ac.be/nl/aanvraag-veiligheidsverificatie (Dutch) or

https://rma.ac.be/sites/default/files/2021-03/Demande%20d%27Avis%20de%20S%C3%A9curit%C3%A9_F.pdf (French).

There is unfortunately no English version of this document.

Please send your complete application by e-mail. Incomplete applications will not be considered. We do not accept applications via LinkedIn. Send ALL of the following elements to Prof Dr ir Rob HAELTERMAN (rob.haelterman@mil.be), ir Charles HAMESSE (charles.hamesse@mil.be) and Dr ir Helena BRUYNINCKX (erm-deao-rswo@mil.be):

a CV and a motivational letter
a scan of your ID card (both sides);
the filled-out security document (Please do not forget to sign & add the denomination ‚ÄúGELEZEN EN GOEDGEKEURD‚Äù (Dutch) or ‚ÄúLU ET APPROUVE‚Äù (French))
your relevant publications (a link to an online open access repository is acceptable)

Please mention clearly the reference of the project in the subject line of your mail: ‚ÄúTaMaCare‚Äù.

(Mails received without this reference or applications sent other than by email to all the above addresses will not be considered. Applications that do not contain all the above elements will also not be considered.)

Application deadline: 16th of August 2024

The interviews will take place at the Royal Military Academy, Hobbemastraat 8, 1000 Brussels. In specific cases, on-line interviews can take place. The date and time of the interview will be communicated to the preselected candidates.




Contract

Date of selection: September 26th 2024
Start of contract: December 1st 2024.
This contract depends on the acceptance of a study proposal. Acceptance will only be known on September 25th. This means that the job offer is currently provisional until that date.
Status: Full-time employment (38 hours / week) based on an open-ended contract with the Patrimony of the Royal Military Academy (you will not be a civil servant).
To be very clear: your contract will be open-ended, but the financing of the contract will be tied to a project that ends on November 30th 2027. The financing of your contract beyond that period is therefore not 100% guaranteed. However, the chance that we will be able to offer a follow-up project beyond that date is high.
Wage scale: class A1 (holder of a Master's Degree in Science, doctor‚Äôs degree in the same area of expertise); class A2 (holder of an Ir degree or equivalent Master's degree in Engineering Sciences, doctor‚Äôs degree in the same area of expertise). RMA-Patrimony applies a merit-based research career track, allowing researchers to advance in wage scale based upon annual evaluations.
Holiday pay.

Extra-legal benefits

Possibility to benefit from a bilingualism allowance (Dutch/French) following a SELOR test;
End-of-year bonus;
Free DKV hospitalization insurance. Possibility of additional affiliation for one or more persons living under the same roof: spouse, child(ren) (50% of the price per additional member);
Bike allowance / Free public transport (home-work commute);
Free access to campus sports facilities outside working hours;
On-campus restaurant and cafeteria with democratic prices (discount on the daily menu);
Meal vouchers (6‚Ç¨/day)
Flexible working hours within the 38-hour week + Teleworking possible with allowance;
Holidays o 29 days holiday / year from the 1st year of contract (then from 45 years: +1 day holiday every 5 years) o + 1 week OFF every year between Christmas and New year‚Äôs Eve
Advantages and interesting offers thanks to the Benefits@work card (discounts, vouchers...);
Entitlement to services offered by the ‚ÄòOffice Central d'Action Sociale et Culturelle de la D√©fense‚Äô (OCASC): among others holiday centres, discount on travel organised by the tour operator...;
Possibility of benefiting from the nursery funded by Belgian Defence (subject to availability).




Workplace

Royal Military Academy, Avenue de la Renaissance 30, 1000 Brussels;
Occasional travels abroad for scientific conferences, etc.

Points of contact

Concerning the research project: to Prof Dr ir Rob HAELTERMAN (rob.haelterman@mil.be )
Concerning the recruitment modalities: Dr ir Helena Bruyninckx (erm-deao-rswo@mil.be)
For more information about the Royal Military Academy, see http://www.rma.ac.be

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About FURTHER

FURTHER is the leading AI-powered customer acquisition platform for senior care and healthcare organizations. Our digital experience platform and sales automation solutions make it easier for consumers to buy and easier for sales teams to sell, increasing conversion rates and driving incremental revenue for our clients. FURTHER is the only data platform in the industry that connects first-party marketing and sales data, making it easier for client marketing teams to be data-driven. FURTHER works with over 4,500 care communities and delivered $1.5B of revenue to our customers in 2023.

The Role

At Further, we transform data into actionable insights to drive our systems and solutions. We seek a creative and curious LLM engineer to join our team. If you have a Natural Language Processing and Software Engineering background, you‚Äôll thrive in this role by developing and improving robust conversational agents that take their users to the next level. You'll collaborate with specialists to "slice and dice" data, develop conversational agents, identify enhancements, and deliver innovative solutions.


Collaborate with product design and engineering teams to understand business and data needs.
Develop, test, and deploy robust conversational agents that meet user needs and project requirements.
Continuously improve the natural language understanding (NLU) and overall performance of conversational agents through customization and optimization techniques.
Implement context-aware conversations and design conversation flows that handle complex user queries effectively.
Develop and execute test plans to assess agent performance, identifying areas for improvement and iterating on data, prompts, and workflows.
Communicate findings to stakeholders effectively.
Stay current with industry developments and technical advancements.


What You‚Äôll Own


Collect, clean, and preprocess data to ensure quality and reliability.
Explore and visualize data to identify patterns, trends, and relationships
Train, evaluate, and deploy customized LLMs.
Test and refine models to ensure their effectiveness.
Monitor model performance and make necessary adjustments.
Present results and suggestions through clear visuals and concise reports.


What You‚Äôll Bring


At least 5 years of professional experience as a Data Scientist or Engineer
Business level English verbal and writing.
A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
A minimum of two years experience as an ML engineer.
Proficiency in data manipulation and analysis tools like SQL and Pandas.
Familiarity with Data Warehousing.
Experience in developing, evaluating, deploying, running, and maintaining ML models.
A strong understanding of AI agents, natural language processing, and machine learning concepts.
At least 5 years of experience using LLMs and LLM-enabled programs in a professional, academic, or personal context, including exploring how they work and how to use them effectively.
Experience with LangChain or other AI agent frameworks.
Experience with LLM observability.
Familiarity with the optimal use of LLMs, the tradeoff between fine-tuning and RAG, etc.
Familiarity with prompt engineering best practices.
Familiarity with data structures for ML and AI programs, including RAG and vector databases.
Experience with building systems and infrastructure is preferred.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.


Equal Opportunity Employer

We hire talented and passionate people from a variety of backgrounds because we want our global employee base to represent the wide diversity of our customers. If you‚Äôre excited about a role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every bullet point listed in the job description, we still encourage you to apply. If you‚Äôre a builder at heart, share our company values, and enthusiastic about making software toolmaking ubiquitous, we want to hear from you.

FURTHER is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristic. FURTHER considers qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. FURTHER is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let your recruiter know.

  • Test and refine models to ensure their effectiveness.
  • Monitor model performance and make necessary adjustments.
  • Present results and suggestions through clear visuals and concise reports.

What You‚Äôll Bring

  • At least 5 years of professional experience as a Data Scientist or Engineer
  • Business level English verbal and writing.
  • A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
  • A minimum of two years experience as an ML engineer.
  • Proficiency in data manipulation and analysis tools like SQL and Pandas.
  • Familiarity with Data Warehousing.
  • Experience in developing, evaluating, deploying, running, and maintaining ML models.
  • A strong understanding of AI agents, natural language processing, and machine learning concepts.
  • At least 5 years of experience using LLMs and LLM-enabled programs in a professional, academic, or personal context, including exploring how they work and how to use them effectively.
  • Experience with LangChain or other AI agent frameworks.
  • Experience with LLM observability.
  • Familiarity with the optimal use of LLMs, the tradeoff between fine-tuning and RAG, etc.
  • Familiarity with prompt engineering best practices.
  • Familiarity with data structures for ML and AI programs, including RAG and vector databases.
  • Experience with building systems and infrastructure is preferred.
  • Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Equal Opportunity Employer

We hire talented and passionate people from a variety of backgrounds because we want our global employee base to represent the wide diversity of our customers. If you‚Äôre excited about a role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every bullet point listed in the job description, we still encourage you to apply. If you‚Äôre a builder at heart, share our company values, and enthusiastic about making software toolmaking ubiquitous, we want to hear from you.

FURTHER is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristic. FURTHER considers qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. FURTHER is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let your recruiter know.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:

Are you a highly skilled data scientist with a passion for extracting insights from complex data sets?

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for a Data Scientist specialising in Cloud Platforms (m/f/d) for our German client.




Start: beginning / middle of September 2024

before. End: 31.12.2024

Scope: approx. 4 days per week

Location: completely remote possible




Tasks:

* Develop and deploy Natural Language Processing (NLP) models in production environments.

* Work extensively with Large Language Models (LLMs) APIs.

* Engage in prompt-engineering, fine-tuning, and evaluation of LLMs to ensure high performance and relevance.

* Collaborate with cross-functional agile software development teams to integrate LLM solutions into healthcare products.

* Implement MLOps practices to streamline the deployment and maintenance of machine learning models.

* Continuously monitor and improve model performance and adapt to new challenges and datasets.

* Document processes, model architectures, and performance metrics for internal and external stakeholders.

* Stay up to date with advancements in Gen AI




Skills:

* Strong programming skills in languages such as Python and familiarity with NLP libraries and frameworks like PyTorch, Hugging Face, etc.

* Experience with cloud platforms like AWS, GCP, or Azure

* Successful projects / background in Biotech or Pharma companies

* Experience in prompt-engineering, fine-tuning and evaluation of LLMs.

Title: Data Scientist (H/F)
Description:
LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment.




For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.




Our big success so far:

A community of more than 40 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions ‚Äì we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up




As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !




What will be your tasks with us ?




You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and production.




You will be working in the following areas:

Business case study with business teams
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Elaboration of Data Science solutions
Going into production with Data Engineers
Creation of POC, model development
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations




Who are you ?

You have a Master in engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics‚Ä¶) and you have some experiences as a Data Scientist !
You have bases in the realization of POC, the development of models and applications starting from- scratch as well as in the putting into production
You master programming best practices such as code versionning (git), IDE use (PyCharm fore.g.), testing, use of CI/CD tools
You are fully proficient in Python, Machine learning & Deep learning frameworks (Scikit-Learn & Tensorflow for e.g.) and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
You are familiar with some of the following domains: time series, NLP, Computer Vision, reinforcement learning, IoT
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Ops Engineer - Brussels, Belgium

Are you passionate about MLOps and AI solutions? We are looking for a skilled Machine Learning Ops Engineer to join our team in Brussels.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop and deploy AI solutions using Python and popular libraries (e.g., pandas, scikit-learn, xgboost).
Ensure high-quality code through comprehensive testing (unit, integration, end-to-end, performance).
Use data validation and type hints to enhance code quality.
Transform Jupyter notebooks into production-grade code.
Package Python applications/libraries for distribution.
Collaborate using GIT, adhering to best practices for branching, merging, and code reviews.
Work with Machine Learning algorithms, especially in NLP.
Utilize cloud platforms, preferably Azure.
Manage Unix/Linux command line tools and scripting.
Troubleshoot data pipelines and interact with Data Engineering teams.

Nice-to-Have Skills:

Experience with data processing libraries (e.g., pydantic, pandera).
Familiarity with web frameworks (e.g., FastAPI, Flask).
Knowledge of CLI frameworks (e.g., Typer, Click).
Experience with MLOps tools and frameworks (e.g., MLFlow, Azure ML Studio).
Proficiency in version control for ML datasets and models (e.g., DVC, Azure ML Dataset).
Monitoring libraries (e.g., NannyML, Evidently AI).
Distributed processing frameworks (e.g., Ray, Dask, PySpark).
Pipeline orchestration libraries (e.g., Metaflow, ZenML, Airflow).
General Python development tools (e.g., pytest, black).

Non-Technical Skills:

Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Experience in large, complex enterprises.
Openness to legacy technology with a drive for modernization.
Up-to-date with new tools and technologies.
Effective team player with Agile project management experience.
Passion for mentoring and sharing knowledge.

Qualifications:

University degree in Software Engineering, Data Science, Machine Learning, Data Engineering, or a related field.
5+ years of experience with Python.
2+ years of experience with DevOps/CI/CD practices.
2+ years of experience deploying AI solutions to production.

To Apply: üìß Send your CV to ranjani.v@ampstek.com.

Title: Machine Learning and AI Consultant
Description:
At Uni Systems, we are working towards turning digital visions into reality. We are continuously growing and we are looking for a Machine Learning and AI Consultant to join our UniQue team.

What will you be doing in this role?

Development and maintenance of software applications in the field of Natural Language Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML) and/or Artificial Intelligence (AI);
Training of custom machine learning / deep learning models based on structured and unstructured data;
Selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques;
Studies and developments aiming at improving the quality of machine translation (MT) engines for each installed language pair, addressing the specific needs of customers of the service concerning MT quality and contributing to a general strategy for the systematic evaluation and long-term improvement of MT quality;
Interact with data stewards and other IT stakeholders to define the data rules;
Define data controls and implement actions to ensure data quality and integrity;
Creating automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance;
Data mining using state-of-the-art methods;
Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis;
Design the IT architecture for solutions in the NLP / ML / AI fields, and coordinate its implementation considering master- and meta-data management concepts.



Requirements



What will you be bringing to the team?

Master Degree in IT or related field with at least 13 years of experience in IT.
Extensive hands-on experience with the design and implementation of Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG).
Very good knowledge of programming in Python (programming in R is considered an asset).
Very good experience with libraries and frameworks like TensorFlow, Hugging Face, PyTorch, scikitlearn, or Keras.
Very good knowledge with using cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud for designing/implementing scalable AI/ML/RAG/etc. solutions.
Extensive hands-on experience with various machine learning algorithms, including supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning.
Good knowledge of deep learning and neural networks.
Knowledge of the involved Mathematics and Statistics (Linear algebra, Calculus, Probability theory, Statistics, Optimization techniques, etc.).
Good knowledge of data pre-processing and analysis techniques.
Good experience with data visualization using tools like Matplotlib, Seaborn or Plotly.
Good experience with RDBMS like Oracle (latest version).
Good experience of NoSQL databases like MongoDB or Cassandra.
Experience in training deep learning models.
Good knowledge of NLP techniques and libraries like NLTK, spaCy, or Transformers.
Extensive experience with model evaluation and validation techniques.
Extensive experience with deploying ML models to production.
Good knowledge of potential bias and fairness issues in AI systems.
Knowledge of the applicable data privacy regulations (GDPR) and compliance with AI/ML applications will be considered as an asset.
Familiarity with reinforcement learning algorithms and environments.
Familiarity with distributed computing frameworks such as Apache Spark or Hadoop for handling large dataset will be considered an asset.
Fluent in English at least at a level B2.



Benefits



At Uni Systems, we are providing equal employment opportunities and banning any form of discrimination on grounds of gender, religion, race, color, nationality, disability, social class, political beliefs, age, marital status, sexual orientation or any other characteristics. Take a look at our Diversity, Equality & Inclusion Policy for more information.

Title: Data Scientist Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital strategy, tech platforms and cybersecurity. By combining creativity, tech and data insights, we empower our customers to transform their business and unlock the future. With 25 years‚Äô experience and 10,000 employees across Europe, the Middle East and Africa, Devoteam promotes responsible tech for people and works to create better change.

Join our global community of exceptional talents at Devoteam, where you‚Äôll collaborate with multidisciplinary teams of data specialists, product designers, business consultants, security experts, cloud engineers, developers, and more across over 20 countries in the EMEA region. As a member of our team, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to work with the world‚Äôs leading partners, including AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft, and ServiceNow, driving innovation and advancing your career.


Job Description

Are you passionate about data-driven platforms, machine learning models, and innovative applications? As a Data Scientist/Engineer at Devoteam, you'll play a hands-on role in delivering impactful solutions across various clients and industries. Each mission we undertake has clear deliverables and deadlines, ensuring you gain diverse experience. For example, one month you might develop a predictive maintenance model, and the next, a customer segmentation model for a retail client.

Key Responsibilities:

Platform Setup: Design and implement robust data platforms using Azure, AWS or Google Cloud and Databricks.
Data Management: Gather, prepare, and manage data for analysis.
Model Research: Investigate and select appropriate machine learning models.
ML Modeling: Develop and refine machine learning models.
Client Collaboration: Spend approximately 50% of your time working directly with clients, either independently or as part of a team.



Your Role:

Build and maintain data platforms and pipelines using Azure, AWS or Google Cloud, Databricks, and Python.
Develop predictive and machine learning models tailored to client needs.
Advise clients on translating their business requirements into technical solutions using machine learning techniques.
Stay updated on the latest trends in machine learning and AI, sharing insights with clients.
Act as a strategic partner to client Data Science teams, helping them navigate their challenges and aspirations.
Inspire clients with new data-driven opportunities.
Bring best practices in Git, DevOps, and CICD to enhance client data platforms.
Collaborate with Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and Business Stakeholders.
Represent Devoteam both online and offline, showcasing our expertise.


Qualifications

About You:

Reside in Belgium.
Hold a university degree in Computer Science, (Business) Engineering, or a specialized master's in Machine Learning or AI.
Have a solid understanding of various machine learning models (e.g., SVM, RNN, Deep Learning) and their applications.
Possess foundational knowledge of Data Science, including sampling techniques and evaluation metrics.
Proficient in SQL and Python.
Experience with Spark and/or cloud ecosystems is a must.
Eager to learn and passionate about data and machine learning technologies.
Excited to join a dynamic and growing team.
Fluent in English; proficiency in Dutch or French is mandatory¬†



¬†


Additional Information

Why choose us?

Cutting-edge Technology: Embrace the latest advancements in IT and digital technologies as we constantly innovate to stay ahead of the competition. Our commitment to adopting state-of-the-art tools and methodologies ensures that you'll work on projects at the forefront of the industry.
Entrepreneur mindset: We value our people over processes. You will develop and grow in an agile and ambitious company where it‚Äôs okay to take risks, make mistakes and change plans to find transformative solutions. At the same time, you will learn from the best, building relationships and skills that will last your entire career.
Endless Learning Opportunities: We value personal and professional growth. Through workshops, conferences, and certifications, we offer the resources needed to expand your skill set and reach new heights in your career.
Connect with amazing people: You will become part of a network of +10,000 Devoteamers spread over 20 countries.
Collaborative Culture: Teamwork is at the heart of our organisation. You'll be working side by side with a diverse group of IT experts who share your passion for excellence and will inspire you to think outside the box.
Impactful Projects: Tackle real-world challenges that matter! From revolutionising business processes to developing innovative solutions, you'll have the chance to make a genuine and positive impact on our clients and the community.
Work-Life Balance: We believe in a healthy work-life balance, ensuring that you have time to unwind, pursue your hobbies, and spend quality time with loved ones.
Inspiring and eco-friendly workplace: We just moved to an amazing new building. We believe an inspiring workspace fuels creativity and fosters a positive work culture, allowing our employees to reach their full potential. The Wings building is also designed with eco-friendly features and energy-efficient systems. By reducing our ecological footprint, we are contributing to a greener future and aligning our business practices with our environmental values. The building is also very easily accessible by public transportation.¬†
Competitive package: We offer a competitive salary package with additional benefits like a company car, smartphone, medical insurance, pension plan, net allowance, laptop, meal vouchers, etc. We review our salary grid twice a year to ensure we are in line with the market.

At Devoteam, we combine strong values ‚Äì respect, frankness, ambition, entrepreneurship & collaboration - with a fun environment that empowers you to innovate and succeed.

HTML:
Company Description

Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital strategy, tech platforms and cybersecurity. By combining creativity, tech and data insights, we empower our customers to transform their business and unlock the future. With 25 years‚Äô experience and 10,000 employees across Europe, the Middle East and Africa, Devoteam promotes responsible tech for people and works to create better change.

Join our global community of exceptional talents at Devoteam, where you‚Äôll collaborate with multidisciplinary teams of data specialists, product designers, business consultants, security experts, cloud engineers, developers, and more across over 20 countries in the EMEA region. As a member of our team, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to work with the world‚Äôs leading partners, including AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft, and ServiceNow, driving innovation and advancing your career.


Job Description

Are you passionate about data-driven platforms, machine learning models, and innovative applications? As a Data Scientist/Engineer at Devoteam, you'll play a hands-on role in delivering impactful solutions across various clients and industries. Each mission we undertake has clear deliverables and deadlines, ensuring you gain diverse experience. For example, one month you might develop a predictive maintenance model, and the next, a customer segmentation model for a retail client.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Platform Setup: Design and implement robust data platforms using Azure, AWS or Google Cloud and Databricks.
  • Data Management: Gather, prepare, and manage data for analysis.
  • Model Research: Investigate and select appropriate machine learning models.
  • ML Modeling: Develop and refine machine learning models.
  • Client Collaboration: Spend approximately 50% of your time working directly with clients, either independently or as part of a team.


Your Role:
  • Build and maintain data platforms and pipelines using Azure, AWS or Google Cloud, Databricks, and Python.
  • Develop predictive and machine learning models tailored to client needs.
  • Advise clients on translating their business requirements into technical solutions using machine learning techniques.
  • Stay updated on the latest trends in machine learning and AI, sharing insights with clients.
  • Act as a strategic partner to client Data Science teams, helping them navigate their challenges and aspirations.
  • Inspire clients with new data-driven opportunities.
  • Bring best practices in Git, DevOps, and CICD to enhance client data platforms.
  • Collaborate with Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and Business Stakeholders.
  • Represent Devoteam both online and offline, showcasing our expertise.


Qualifications

About You:
  • Reside in Belgium.
  • Hold a university degree in Computer Science, (Business) Engineering, or a specialized master's in Machine Learning or AI.
  • Have a solid understanding of various machine learning models (e.g., SVM, RNN, Deep Learning) and their applications.
  • Possess foundational knowledge of Data Science, including sampling techniques and evaluation metrics.
  • Proficient in SQL and Python.
  • Experience with Spark and/or cloud ecosystems is a must.
  • Eager to learn and passionate about data and machine learning technologies.
  • Excited to join a dynamic and growing team.
  • Fluent in English; proficiency in Dutch or French is mandatory 


 


Additional Information

Why choose us?
  1. Cutting-edge Technology: Embrace the latest advancements in IT and digital technologies as we constantly innovate to stay ahead of the competition. Our commitment to adopting state-of-the-art tools and methodologies ensures that you'll work on projects at the forefront of the industry.
  2. Entrepreneur mindset: We value our people over processes. You will develop and grow in an agile and ambitious company where it‚Äôs okay to take risks, make mistakes and change plans to find transformative solutions. At the same time, you will learn from the best, building relationships and skills that will last your entire career.
  3. Endless Learning Opportunities: We value personal and professional growth. Through workshops, conferences, and certifications, we offer the resources needed to expand your skill set and reach new heights in your career.
  4. Connect with amazing people: You will become part of a network of +10,000 Devoteamers spread over 20 countries.
  5. Collaborative Culture: Teamwork is at the heart of our organisation. You'll be working side by side with a diverse group of IT experts who share your passion for excellence and will inspire you to think outside the box.
  6. Impactful Projects: Tackle real-world challenges that matter! From revolutionising business processes to developing innovative solutions, you'll have the chance to make a genuine and positive impact on our clients and the community.
  7. Work-Life Balance: We believe in a healthy work-life balance, ensuring that you have time to unwind, pursue your hobbies, and spend quality time with loved ones.
  8. Inspiring and eco-friendly workplace: We just moved to an amazing new building. We believe an inspiring workspace fuels creativity and fosters a positive work culture, allowing our employees to reach their full potential. The Wings building is also designed with eco-friendly features and energy-efficient systems. By reducing our ecological footprint, we are contributing to a greener future and aligning our business practices with our environmental values. The building is also very easily accessible by public transportation. 
  9. Competitive package: We offer a competitive salary package with additional benefits like a company car, smartphone, medical insurance, pension plan, net allowance, laptop, meal vouchers, etc. We review our salary grid twice a year to ensure we are in line with the market.
At Devoteam, we combine strong values ‚Äì respect, frankness, ambition, entrepreneurship & collaboration - with a fun environment that empowers you to innovate and succeed.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Description

We currently have a vacancy for a Data Scientist fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert remotely. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client‚Äôs IT team.

Your Tasks

  • Coordination and review of policy units‚Äô business needs;
  • Carry out ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) tasks;
  • Creating, designing and developing data models;
  • Analyze large datasets and propose approaches for optimization of reporting;
  • Assessment and quality control of data;
  • Preparation of statistical analysis of data for use by policy officers and other stakeholders;
  • Management and processing of data;
  • Reporting of key indicators for different policy fields on the basis of data sets available;
  • Development and maintenance of interactive dashboards in Power BI;
  • Assistance with data management aspects of IT projects.

Requirements

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with 5 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • Excellent knowledge of Data Analytics techniques and tools;
  • Very good knowledge of reporting and statistics;
  • Good knowledge of Power BI;
  • Experience with one or more of the following: Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing, Languages like R, Python, PERL, Other business intelligence tools (Tableau, SAS, SAP, GoodData‚Ä¶), ETL processes and tools (i.e. Talend Open Studio‚Ä¶);
  • Knowledge of SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL);
  • Knowledge of architectural design and implementation of scalable modern data stores;
  • Knowledge in one of the following areas: predictive (forecasting, recommendation), prescriptive (simulation), sentiment analysis, topic detection, social media crawling and processing, plagiarism detection, trends/anomalies detection in datasets, recommendation systems;
  • Excellent command of the English language.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
What can you expect?

Python Predictions is currently looking for a Data Scientist. As we are growing fast, we are looking for people to support and participate in this growth. We are looking for a person with a passion for data science, interested in leading concrete business projects in a wide variety of domains and applications.

In this role, you will work closely with other Data Profiles from Python Predictions but also from our clients‚Äô internal teams. You will lead the way and participate in multiple advanced analytics projects from the ideation phase to the value delivery. Every step of the way, you will ensure the quality of the analytical solution as well as the actionability towards the business stakeholders.

Does this sound like your ideal day-to-day drill? Then don‚Äôt wait any longer and let‚Äôs meet.




Who are we looking for?

You have multiple years of experience in a variety of data science applications (not all, but not limited to one either).
You understand that organizations today should make the most of the available information, in order to turn this information into value. You have acquired relevant skills through your past experiences.
You are as proficient in Python as you are in English, Dutch or French (all other (programming) languages are a plus).
You are motivated by obtaining concrete deliverables and results. You want to make a difference for the organizations you work for, and you like to be recognized for your input.
You can work independently, but you also appreciate collaboration. You are open-minded and have no fear of expressing your opinion in a constructive way.
You have experience in project management and people management.




What do we have to offer?

Python Predictions is a Brussels-based service provider specialized in data projects with business impact.
In January 2020, Python Predictions joined Tobania ‚Äì a leading Belgian business & technology consulting firm. And in turn, in March 2023, Tobania joined Sopra Steria ‚Äì a major Tech player in Europe recognized for its consulting, digital services and software development.
Great variation in job content due to short and long term missions in different industries, different domains and different environments.
A competitive salary, with plenty of fringe benefits.
A diverse team of supportive colleagues with different backgrounds, skills and interests but shared values who‚Äôll make you feel right at home.
The opportunity to turn these new colleagues into friends during our legendary afterwork drinks and other exciting events.
In-company training adapted to your personal needs.
Continuous learning in monthly team meetings and personal development time.
A chance to exploit your talents in our Tobania.Academy and on-the-job coaching.
A workstation at one of our customers‚Äô offices, at Python‚Äôs Brussels office but also at any Tobania‚Äôs location!

Discover our Tobania galaxy

Title: AI Research Engineer
Description:
About Our Client

Our client is an early-stage, deep-tech start-up at the forefront of developing cutting-edge AI-driven technology. They are fueled by a strong sense of mission and enthusiasm, striving to democratize data-driven decision-making on a global scale. They collaborate with leading organizations and are backed by veteran entrepreneurs and angel investors.




Role Overview

We are seeking an ambitious AI Research Engineer to join our client's team in Leuven. This role is instrumental in developing a next-generation financial digital twin powered by a causal, human-in-the-loop, automated, multivariate time-series forecasting engine. This engine utilizes a custom AI stack and proprietary algorithms developed by our client‚Äôs technical founders at a renowned machine learning lab.




Key Responsibilities




AI Research and Development:

Conduct research to develop innovative AI models and algorithms.
Experiment with and implement state-of-the-art AI techniques to improve product performance.
Set up experiments to test algorithm performance, evaluate results, and design improvements.
Collaborate with academic and industry partners to stay at the forefront of AI advancements.




Continuous Improvement:

Stay updated with the latest AI research, tools, and technologies.
Identify and suggest improvements to existing AI models and processes for enhanced performance and scalability.
Participate in conferences, workshops, and seminars to keep abreast of AI advancements.




Documentation and Communication:

Create and maintain documentation for research findings, algorithms, and development processes.
Communicate effectively with team members and stakeholders regarding research progress, technical challenges, and project requirements.
Assist the CTO in creating technical presentations and reports to intuitively convey complex ideas and roadmaps.




Mentorship and Knowledge Sharing:

Provide guidance and mentorship to junior researchers and interns.
Share knowledge and best practices with the team to foster a collaborative and innovative research environment.




Qualifications




Proven experience (3+ years) in AI research and development, ideally in a startup or fast-paced environment.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and familiarity with AI/ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, SciKit-learn).
Strong understanding of AI techniques, including machine learning, time-series forecasting, probabilistic reasoning, and deep learning.
Strong communication skills and ability to work effectively in a team.
Advanced degree (Master‚Äôs or PhD) in Computer Science, AI, Machine Learning, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
Pragmatic problem-solving skills.




Nice to Haves:

Experience in data engineering, including designing and managing data pipelines and workflows.
Experience with multivariate time-series forecasting (including seasonality and trend analysis).
