Title: Data Scientist
Description:
VIATRIS BV

At VIATRIS, we see healthcare not as it is but as it should be. We act courageously and are uniquely positioned to be a source of stability in a world of evolving healthcare needs.

Viatris empowers people worldwide to live healthier at every stage of life.

We do so via:

Access ‚Äì Providing high quality trusted medicines regardless of geography or circumstance;

Leadership ‚Äì Advancing sustainable operations and innovative solutions to improve patient health; and

Partnership ‚Äì Leveraging our collective expertise to connect people to products and services.

Every day, we rise to the challenge to make a difference and here‚Äôs how the Data Scientist role will make an impact:

Key Responsibilities for This Role Include:

Enhancing the advancement of CRM systems through the integration of AI technologies, the Data Scientist will support strategic decision-making by leveraging advanced data analytics, predictive models, and machine learning, ultimately enhancing business intelligence and operational efficiency.


Implement and integrate new versions and functionalities of existing CRM systems, in collaboration with Regional and Global teams, to bring system capabilities to the next level.
Manage and optimize the existing CRM systems to ensure accurate and up-to-date customer data.
Ensure that data management procedures are up-to-date and provide end-users training on CRM functionalities.
Analyse large and complex datasets using AI techniques to identify patterns and deliver insights for strategic decision-making.
Develop and implement predictive models, machine learning algorithms, and AI-driven statistical analyses to support the transformation of business operations.
Perform regular data audits to identify and rectify inaccuracies or inconsistencies, ensuring higher data quality.
Create and maintain dashboards, reports, and data visualizations to communicate insights and performance metrics to internal stakeholders.



The minimum qualifications for this role are:


Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Business Management, Marketing or a related field.
Minimum 3-5 years experience in supporting the business goals and needs.
Fluent in FR and/or NL, with strong EN capabilities
In-depth knowledge of CRM systems (Salesforce, Veeva)
Good understanding of programming languages (Python, R, Java, or others)
Experience with Power BI
Experience in data management and model development
Strong business acumen and capability to translate business requirements into data modelling.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.



At Viatris, we offer competitive salaries, benefits and an inclusive environment where you can use your experiences, perspectives and skills to help make an impact on the lives of others.

Viatris is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

At Viatris, we offer competitive salaries, benefits and an inclusive environment where you can use your experiences, perspectives and skills to help make an impact on the lives of others.

Viatris is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Position Overview

Join ARRISE, a leading supplier of player-favorite content to the iGaming industry, as a dynamic and dedicated Data Scientist. In this demanding yet rewarding role, you will leverage cutting-edge technologies like computer vision, natural language processing, and deep learning to redefine the gaming experience. With a laser focus on excellence, you will push your limits to deliver advanced solutions, collaborating with cross-functional teams on complex challenges.

About You

You are a passionate and self-driven Data Scientist who thrives in a fast-paced environment. Your analytical mindset and strong problem-solving and communication skills allow you to easily navigate complex problem statements. You are driven by innovation and eager to stay updated on the latest trends in recommender systems, machine learning, and data engineering. Mistakes are growth opportunities, and you approach them with a positive, learning-focused attitude.

What You Will Do


Design and develop advanced ML algorithms for image, text, audio, and tabular data
Develop and optimize pipelines in Azure to train models across various domains
Implement end-to-end applications in Python, including unit and integration tests
Continuously monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to produce solutions to complex problems
Develop common packages and tools for logging, model inference, and more



Required Qualifications And Experience


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Strong proficiency in Python, PyTorch, and TensorFlow
Proven experience in managing and analyzing large datasets
Solid understanding of foundational DL algorithms
Expertise in unit and integration tests (Pytest) and CICD pipelines
Experience with data versioning, model management, experiment tracking, key evaluation metrics, and optimization techniques
Extensive knowledge and hands-on experience in Docker
Solid understanding of traditional Computer Vision and classical ML



Nice to Have


In-depth experience with computer vision models for object detection, image classification, and segmentation
Experience with Azure services (ML Studio, Data Factory, Functions, Blob Storage) or equivalent cloud provider services
Knowledge of AWS (Amazon Web Services) services, especially EC2 and S3
Experience with Huggingface Transformers, Elastic Stack, Gitlab CI pipelines
Experience with Prompt Engineering, Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), LLM frameworks (LangChain, LlamaIndex, Haystack, ...), and fine-tuning LLMs



Benefits


Highly competitive salary
Detailed company training on the highest standards
Friendly and supportive culture
Tremendous growth opportunities in a large, fast-moving international company



About Us

ARRISE, a leading supplier of player-favorite content to the iGaming industry. We are a software development and services company delivering end-to-end digital solutions. Headquartered in Gibraltar with offices around the world, including Malta, Romania, India, Canada, and Bulgaria, we are a global team of over 5,000 talented individuals with decades of experience across multiple industries and professions. Together, we form a cross-functional powerhouse that is driven to deliver.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer F/M/X
Description:
Who are we?

Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade ‚Äì this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We‚Äôre focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:

Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!

Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.

We look forward to meeting you!

Job Description

We are currently seeking a Machine Learning Engineer to join our dynamic team at Amaris Consulting, located in Belgium. This role is a unique opportunity for those passionate about AI and machine learning, looking to apply their skills in a challenging yet rewarding environment.

üî•Your Responsibilities:



Developing machine learning models from scratch and improving existing ones
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and provide appropriate solutions.
Data preprocessing including data cleaning, normalization, and transformation.
Evaluating model performance using suitable metrics and validation techniques
Maintaining clear documentation of the development process for future reference and audits
Staying updated with the latest trends in machine learning algorithms, tools, industry best practices
Promoting knowledge sharing within the team through presentations or workshops on new findings or technologies related to ML/AI
Troubleshooting any issues that arise during the development or deployment of ML models



üéØ Your Profile:

The ideal candidate is a recent graduate who has a strong passion for artificial intelligence (AI) & machine learning (ML). You should be eager to learn new things continuously while being able to work effectively as part of a diverse team.



A bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science/engineering/mathematics or related field is required; a masters degree is advantageous.
Familiarity with Python programming language along with libraries such as TensorFlow/Keras/PyTorch used in ML applications.
An understanding of various Machine Learning algorithms like Regression Models, Decision Trees etc., along with their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
Good understanding of data structures, data modeling and software architecture
An analytical mindset with problem-solving skills.
Ability to troubleshoot complex software issues
Excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with team members and stakeholders
Able to work independently as well as in a team environment.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and French or Dutch.
Minimum 1 to 7 years of experience.



‚ÄØüöÄ Advantages:



An international learning environment
Extensive training and certifications.
A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ



üí° We are an independent company that values:



Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.



Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for..

a data scientist with a strong knowledge in machine and deep learning to strengthen the activities of our innovation team and Earth Observation activities. GIM uses an open innovation approach to respond flexibly to our rapidly changing ecosystem and to continuously renew our products and services portfolio.







Below you will not find a standard vacancy, you will read a short story about where you will make the difference. Do you want work with us on a society in which geospatial data empower people to live better lives and make better decisions? Get in touch!







As experienced data science professional

I am the driving force behind our Earth Observation AI developments that are used for the further extension of our Belmap product and on customer projects. I actively follow-up new developments and technologies in the data science / machine learning / deep learning & computer vision domains. I provide technical input for research proposals centered around AI for GEO and Earth Observation, and implement the resulting innovation projects.




I contribute to our excellent customer experience by supporting my sales colleagues on their customer visits and contribute to the (pre)sales process by thinking along with the customer, delivering technical advice and giving demos. Together with the team, I translate the customer needs into a concrete project strategy and set up an action plan to ensure the successful delivery of the customer solution. My fluency in Dutch (mandatory!) as well as English, is a big asset in this context. I keep an eye on the project agreements that were made regarding budget, planning and deadlines, and contribute to great project results. My experience with working on complex projects and my excellent communication skills ensure that we create win-win situations with our customers.




I keep up-to-date on the newest technical and scientific developments within the machine learning, Earth Observation and geotechnology domains and share my knowledge with my GIM colleagues. By continuously renewing this technological knowledge and applying it to rapidly evolving customer demands, I also help to ensure that GIMs' products and services portfolio continues to meet the future needs of customers.







What do we offer you?

At GIM we are convinced that employees make the difference. This is why we give them every opportunity to shine in a self-organizing context where we distribute clear areas of responsibility with lots of decision power. We offer you a versatile function in a dynamic and highly innovative company, excellent working conditions and real possibilities for career development. Our salary packages are market conform with excellent fringe benefits, and we give you the choice to opt for a mobility budget, fitting to your personal needs.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
OfferFit was founded by ex-McKinsey and BCG math PhDs, and we‚Äôre funded by leading Silicon Valley VCs. OfferFit replaces A/B testing with AI testing, powered by reinforcement learning AI. This allows lifecycle marketers to test & improve the performance of their campaigns much faster than before. Customers include leading brands like Brinks Home, Yelp, Engie, and MetLife, among many others.




Note for Applicants:




Data shows that men on average apply for a role if they meet 6/10 requirements while women often only do so if it‚Äôs 10/10. We work hard to be clear and specific about what our roles require, and we encourage you to apply even if you don‚Äôt check all the boxes! Applying gives you the opportunity to be considered and we look forward to reviewing your application!




Position Overview:




Do you enjoy working on data-intensive products and being involved in projects from an early stage? Come join our quickly growing Engineering team to help design, improve and scale OfferFit's self-learning (reinforcement learning) AI platform.




In particular, you will:




Use robust software engineering best practices to design, implement, and improve modular components in a cutting-edge ML product.
Work closely with customer-facing teams to understand, translate, and generalize particular use cases to generic platform components.
Apply your extensive knowledge of Python and its ecosystem to produce clean, readable, and extendible code, and coach others on the team in doing the same.
Collaborate with teams responsible for OfferFit‚Äôs product strategy and roadmap.
Support teams implementing OfferFit for customers to ensure their success.
Work closely with our Applied Science team (data scientists) to help productize and deploy attribution and reinforcement learning algorithm improvements
Improve our core data pipelines and reporting architecture.




Tech stack:




Data Science/Back End: Python (Pandas, Polars, Ibis, Spark), SQL, BigQuery, FastAPI
Web [Not required for this role]: JavaScript (Vue, Node.js), HTML, CSS
Architecture/DevOps: Kubernetes, Airflow, Terraform, GCP
We write well-tested, type-hinted, documented, modular code and use pre-commit hooks, CI/CD, and issue tracking for development.




Why is it great:




No toy datasets in notebooks ‚Äî we‚Äôre implementing AI pipelines in production at scale!

Learn tons about data architecture, data science, and self-learning AI.
Work in a team that not only talks the talk of development best practices, but walks the walk ‚Äî unit & integration tests, modular design, CI/CD, pair programming, code reviews ‚Äî the works.
Join OfferFit‚Äôs fast-paced, supportive, and professional team. We make sure all of our team members are empowered and receive great mentorship and coaching.




Who‚Äôs a Fit:




Exceptional coder: you write clean, object-oriented code; you care about good design and terse, testable APIs.
Tinkerer: you regularly explore and learn new technologies and methods, especially in the data architecture and data science domains.
Entrepreneurial: you proactively identify opportunities and risks, work around obstacles, and always seek creative ways to improve processes and outcomes.
Structured and organized: you can structure a plan, align stakeholders, and see it through to execution.
Clear communicator: you are able to express yourself clearly and persuasively, both in writing and speech.
Background in Machine Learning Engineering and/or Data Engineering is preferred. Some Data Science experience is nice-to-have but is not required.




Ideal Skills and Experience:




2+ years of experience working with Python in a production setting, including 1+ years in the data / machine learning ecosystem
Experience working with at least one major cloud platform (GCP, AWS, Azure, etc.)
Experience putting ML models into production
General understanding of supervised learning principles is a plus but not required




OfferFit Benefits and Perks:




Generous PTO (starting at 25 days PTO per year) and Parental leave policy (12 weeks paid)
100% remote work environment with flexible hours
Quarterly gatherings where we meet in person in a different city to work together, bond as a team and celebrate our progress
Weekly team events (lunch and learns, trivia, virtual escape rooms, town hall and team health ‚Äúbarometer‚Äù meetings)
Ability to learn and develop from an experienced leadership team (ex-Amazon, McKinsey, BCG, and IBM, among others) who are focused on building a talented, diverse, and inclusive team
Dedication to building a strong culture (e.g., team resource groups, weekly recognitions, major life event celebrations, mental health/sustainability days off, etc.)




Additional Requirements:




Fluency in English is required for this position
Ability to partially overlap with US time zones required

100% remote work environment with flexible hours
Quarterly gatherings where we meet in person in a different city to work together, bond as a team and celebrate our progress
Weekly team events (lunch and learns, trivia, virtual escape rooms, town hall and team health ‚Äúbarometer‚Äù meetings)
Ability to learn and develop from an experienced leadership team (ex-Amazon, McKinsey, BCG, and IBM, among others) who are focused on building a talented, diverse, and inclusive team
Dedication to building a strong culture (e.g., team resource groups, weekly recognitions, major life event celebrations, mental health/sustainability days off, etc.)




Please note that we adjust compensation for non‚ÄìUS countries using a relative cost of labor adjustment between the US and your country of residence. Applicants should apply via OfferFit‚Äôs internal or external careers site.




OfferFit is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. OfferFit is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

  2. Work in a team that not only talks the talk of development best practices, but walks the walk ‚Äî unit & integration tests, modular design, CI/CD, pair programming, code reviews ‚Äî the works.
  3. Join OfferFit‚Äôs fast-paced, supportive, and professional team. We make sure all of our team members are empowered and receive great mentorship and coaching.


Who‚Äôs a Fit:


  • Exceptional coder: you write clean, object-oriented code; you care about good design and terse, testable APIs.
  • Tinkerer: you regularly explore and learn new technologies and methods, especially in the data architecture and data science domains.
  • Entrepreneurial: you proactively identify opportunities and risks, work around obstacles, and always seek creative ways to improve processes and outcomes.
  • Structured and organized: you can structure a plan, align stakeholders, and see it through to execution.
  • Clear communicator: you are able to express yourself clearly and persuasively, both in writing and speech.
  • Background in Machine Learning Engineering and/or Data Engineering is preferred. Some Data Science experience is nice-to-have but is not required.


Ideal Skills and Experience:


  • 2+ years of experience working with Python in a production setting, including 1+ years in the data / machine learning ecosystem
  • Experience working with at least one major cloud platform (GCP, AWS, Azure, etc.)
  • Experience putting ML models into production
  • General understanding of supervised learning principles is a plus but not required


OfferFit Benefits and Perks:


  • Generous PTO (starting at 25 days PTO per year) and Parental leave policy (12 weeks paid)
  • 100% remote work environment with flexible hours
  • Quarterly gatherings where we meet in person in a different city to work together, bond as a team and celebrate our progress
  • Weekly team events (lunch and learns, trivia, virtual escape rooms, town hall and team health ‚Äúbarometer‚Äù meetings)
  • Ability to learn and develop from an experienced leadership team (ex-Amazon, McKinsey, BCG, and IBM, among others) who are focused on building a talented, diverse, and inclusive team
  • Dedication to building a strong culture (e.g., team resource groups, weekly recognitions, major life event celebrations, mental health/sustainability days off, etc.)


Additional Requirements:


  • Fluency in English is required for this position
  • Ability to partially overlap with US time zones required

Please note that we adjust compensation for non‚ÄìUS countries using a relative cost of labor adjustment between the US and your country of residence. Applicants should apply via OfferFit‚Äôs internal or external careers site.


OfferFit is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. OfferFit is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
What can you expect?

Python Predictions is currently looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer. In this role, you will need to be able to adapt quickly to new technologies, applications and environments. You will operate with our current clients on a medium to long-term basis.

As an ML Engineer, you will help our clients building and serving machine learning models. More specifically, the responsibilities include:

Design and implement solutions to serve machine learning models, from traditional ML to Generative AI.
Train, improve, and deploy ML models.
Write production ready code and serve online, batch, and real time models
Identify, design, and implement process improvements in the machine learning lifecylce: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-design infrastructure for greater scalability, etc
Collaborate with Data Scientists, MLOps Engineers and Data Engineers, to integrate all parts of the solution.
Coach colleagues and clients in your area of expertise







Who are we looking for?

Required

Master or PhD in Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Engineering, or related field.
At least 3 years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, Data Scientist, MLOps Engineer, or in a similar position.
Strong software engineering background
Experience deploying machine learning in production
Experience with experiment tracking, models monitoring, and deployment strategies
Ability to write production ready code in Python.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and understanding of Infrastructure as Code
Knowledge of containers and container orchestration.
Master software engineering best practices and software release cycle.
Solid understanding of Linux and in depth knowledge of at least one cloud provider.
Knowledge of big data technologies such as Apache Spark, Kafka.
Able to coach others and give technical advice and direction.Experience building, scheduling and maintaining ML pipelines
Able to work independently, prioritize multiple stakeholders and tasks, and manage work time effectively
Proficient in English, knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus







What do we have to offer?

Python Predictions is a Brussels-based service provider specialized in data projects with business impact
In January 2020, Python Predictions joined Tobania ‚Äì a leading Belgian business & technology consulting. And in turn, in March 2023, Tobania joined Sopra Steria ‚Äì a major Tech player in Europe recognized for its consulting, digital services and software development
Great variation in job content due to missions in different industries, different domains and different environments
In-company training adapted to your personal needs
Continuous learning in monthly team meetings and personal development time
A great team of colleagues with shared values

Discover our Tobania galaxy

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Are you ready to shape the future of AI? Clario are looking for a visionary AI Engineer to propel our innovative journey forward in the clinical trials and pharmaceutical industries. Dive into the heart of AI research and development, where your expertise in machine learning, deep learning, and software engineering will fuel transformative solutions that redefine business success and directly impact the lives of patients globally.




What we offer

Competitive compensation
Attractive benefits (security, flexibility, support and well-being)
Remote or hybrid working
Full technology setup and support




What you'll be doing

The AI Engineer will play a key role in researching, designing, developing, and implementing AI-based solutions that drive business objectives and contribute to the advancement of our AI capabilities. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in machine learning, deep learning, and software engineering, along with a passion for tackling challenging problems using AI techniques.

Research, design, and implement ML/Deep Learning models applied to natural language processing, data classification, and other areas.
Design and implement solutions leveraging state of the art GenAI models, including Large Language models.
Participate in the fine-tuning of LLMs, including the preparation of data sets.
Perform required accuracy measures and model validations.
Collaborate with product managers, domain experts, and medical scientists to define requirements.
Partner with software engineers for seamless integration of AI models, ensuring operational success.
Engage with scientific literature to stay ahead of emerging trends.
Drive automation and efficiency improvements in our workflows.
Provide support to internal teams, facilitating resolution of technical issues.
Identify and pursue new opportunities to add value to the organization and departmental processes.
Foster a collaborative environment, supporting colleagues in achieving collective and individual goals.




What we look for

Degree in Computer Science, Biomedical Engineering, Physics, or a related field
3+ Years of experience Developing natural language processing models/applications with a proficiency in programming languages such as Python or C++
Performing model training across different model architectures and data modalities
Strong understanding of various Deep Learning techniques.
Past experience developing AI models for the healthcare and life science industry a plus.
Solid understanding of machine learning tools and techniques (e.g., Pytorch, Keras, TensorFlow, Pandas, Scikit-learn).
Familiarity with software and systems engineering concepts, including cloud computing, continuous integration, and continuous deployment (CI/CD) is a plus.
Exceptional motivational and team-building skills, fostering a collaborative and inclusive team environment. Ability to work in group setting and independently.
Ability to organize and prioritize assigned tasks to meet established schedules, timelines, or deadlines.
Problem solving abilities.
Excellent attention to detail and meticulous work.




At Clario, we put people first, always. We are united and driven by patients, committed to making a difference, and we are always looking for the best talent to help us transform lives. We value the contribution each of our people brings. It‚Äôs only through our people that we can continue to innovate technology that will shape the future of clinical trials.




Clario is committed to providing an inclusive workplace that welcomes diversity and equal opportunity. We encourage all qualified candidates who are passionate about sustainability, ethical business, and making a positive impact to apply for this role.

Title: Applied Machine Learning Research Engineer
Description:
Senior Applied Machine Learning Researcher - Distributed Model Training

Remote




We're hiring for a Machine Learning Researcher for a Series A start-up (over 50 million in funding and backed by top investors). The team are pushing the boundaries of machine learning research in a decentralized and heterogeneous environment. The mission is to train highly distributed models over uniquely decentralized infrastructure, revolutionizing the way neural networks are built and deployed.




Responsibilities:




Train models on decentralized and heterogeneous infrastructure, focusing on high-volume model training.
Serve as a bridge between researchers generating novel ideas and production engineers implementing them.
Manage and maintain experimental frameworks and test benches for ML research.
Provide engineering support, addressing reproducibility and other ML-related issues.
Follow best practices in design, testing, and documentation of code.
Publish research papers for top-tier AI conferences (NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, AAAI, IJCAI) and collaborate with academic and research institutions.




Minimum Requirements:




Strong background in applied machine learning with hands-on experience in training models.
Proficient in building and managing distributed systems.
Strong coding skills with a focus on running experiments rather than developing novel concepts.
Comfortable working in a high-autonomy, unpredictable research environment.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.




Preferred Qualifications:




Experience with highly distributed model training.




Please apply for more details, we're looking forward to hearing from you

Title: Machine Learning Software Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Software Engineer




Distributed ML Training




Location: Fully Remote

Type: Full-time




Join an innovative Series A Deep Tech company at the forefront of AI and blockchain technology! Backed by top investors with over $50 million in funding, our client is a team of 20 industry experts, looking to grow to 35. They are leveraging blockchain to provide globally accessible computing resources for AI platforms and are seeking world-class engineers to accelerate AI progress. This is a fully remote role offering a high level of autonomy.




Responsibilities:




ML Orchestration System Design: Develop systems for orchestrating ML execution across decentralized and heterogeneous infrastructure.
Performance Optimization: Profile and optimize training algorithms continually.
Implement Novel Research: Build new mechanisms and algorithms to solve unprecedented problems.
Engineering Support: Collaborate on broader ML issues, such as reproducible training.
Technical Writing and Engagement: Contribute to technical reports and papers, and engage with the community.




Minimum Requirements:




Distributed Foundation Model Training: Experience designing or working with training systems on large clusters.
Networking Proficiency: Understanding and troubleshooting experience with IP, TCP, UDP, HTTP, and communication backends like NCCL, GLOO, and MPI.
Open Source Contributions: Experience with large open-source codebases as a maintainer or trusted contributor.
Rust Enthusiasm: Willingness to learn Rust to work across the codebase.
Computer Science Background: Solid understanding of computational complexity and broad knowledge of algorithms and data structures.
Self-motivation and Communication: Highly self-motivated with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Applied Research Comfort: Comfortable working in a high-autonomy, unpredictable applied research environment.




Bonus Skills:




Rust Expertise: Strong experience with systems programming in Rust, understanding lifetimes, and the purpose of Pin.
Research Experience: Published research in distributed systems or ML domains.
Blockchain Knowledge: Understanding of blockchain fundamentals.







Be part of a team dedicated to democratizing AI, where you can leverage your expertise in distributed ML training, networking, and open-source contributions to make a significant impact. Embrace autonomy, continuous learning, and the drive to push innovative solutions in a highly collaborative and flexible environment.




Apply now to join this cutting-edge team and contribute to the future of AI!

Title: MLops Engineer (Data Science)
Description:
We are looking for an engineering profile with a data science background and a focus on MLops and Azure cloud environment to join our team.

We're building our cloud environment from the ground up and need new talent to join our team and help us scale to 100+ projects. Azure machine learning is a central component in the cloud architecture. Additionally, we want to improve our on-premises environment, which won‚Äôt disappear anytime soon, and blend some azure components in it.

Next to the MLops role, you'll have the opportunity to work on data science use cases, this entails you will help business define and scope the problem, pick the right machine learning solution and technology as well as ensure implementation, integration and deployment of your solution to production.

If you're someone who loves to think about architecture, set it up, and then figure out how to break it, we want to hear from you!

Responsibilities


Automating everything related to the ML lifecycle to ensure efficiency and scalability.
Using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) practices, such as Bicep, to manage and provision resources through code.
Implementing best practices for continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD) pipelines, ensuring that ML models are reliably deployed to production environments.
Collaborate with data scientists to deploy, monitor, and troubleshoot machine learning models and applications using Azure Machine Learning, Azure devops and Azure AI Services.
Challenge our existing security and reinforce our defenses.



Profile


Master's degree in computer science, data science, engineering, or related field.
At least 2 years of experience in data engineering, data science, or related roles.
Proficient in Python.
Experience with Azure cloud services and tools, notably azure machine learning and azure devops.
Experience with mlops concepts and frameworks.
Knowledge on containerized deployment of ML products ‚Äì e.g. docker, podman, Kubernetes.
Excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills.
Fluent in English is a must. Dutch and/or French is considered as a plus.

Title: MLops Engineer (Data Science)
Description:
We are looking for an engineering profile with a data science background and a focus on MLops and Azure cloud environment to join our team.

We're building our cloud environment from the ground up and need new talent to join our team and help us scale to 100+ projects. Azure machine learning is a central component in the cloud architecture. Additionally, we want to improve our on-premises environment, which won‚Äôt disappear anytime soon, and blend some azure components in it.

Next to the MLops role, you'll have the opportunity to work on data science use cases, this entails you will help business define and scope the problem, pick the right machine learning solution and technology as well as ensure implementation, integration and deployment of your solution to production.

If you're someone who loves to think about architecture, set it up, and then figure out how to break it, we want to hear from you!

Responsibilities


Automating everything related to the ML lifecycle to ensure efficiency and scalability.
Using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) practices, such as Bicep, to manage and provision resources through code.
Implementing best practices for continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD) pipelines, ensuring that ML models are reliably deployed to production environments.
Collaborate with data scientists to deploy, monitor, and troubleshoot machine learning models and applications using Azure Machine Learning, Azure devops and Azure AI Services.
Challenge our existing security and reinforce our defenses.



Profile


Master's degree in computer science, data science, engineering, or related field.
At least 2 years of experience in data engineering, data science, or related roles.
Proficient in Python.
Experience with Azure cloud services and tools, notably azure machine learning and azure devops.
Experience with mlops concepts and frameworks.
Knowledge on containerized deployment of ML products ‚Äì e.g. docker, podman, Kubernetes.
Excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills.
Fluent in English is a must. Dutch and/or French is considered as a plus.



Show more

Languages: English

Title: (Gen) AI and Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
As Stephen Few states: ‚ÄúWe are overwhelmed by information, not because there is too much, but because we haven't learned how to tame it.‚Äù Capgemini Insights & Data is looking for people who tame data in such a way that the most complex data can be easily interpreted.

We are looking for a (GEN) AI and Machine Learning Engineer to help our clients in their digital transformations.

Key tasks & activities


Use ML and Generative AI tools and other technologies to design, evangelize, and implement state-of-the-art solutions for never-before-solved problems.
Define and implement best practices for building, testing, and deploying scalable AI solutions, with a focus on generative models and LLM.
Drive successful business outcomes for educating, training, designing and building cloud hosted Generative AI solutions
Interact with customers directly to understand the business problem, help and aid them in implementation of their ML ecosystem
Educate customers on the value proposition of GenAI and showcase the art of possible.
Participate in deep architectural discussions and design exercises to create solutions while ensuring solutions are designed for successful deployment in the cloud.
Stay at the forefront of AI technological advancements, especially in Generative AI and LLM, and assess their applicability to our business needs.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, AI/ML & data engineers, and functional SMEs, to ensure seamless integration and alignment of AI solutions with business objectives. influence the technical viability of the architecture of AI projects, ensuring optimal performance, scalability, and integration.
Develop Solutions to ensure robust and secure data pipelines and infrastructure to support AI model training and deployment.
Lead the evaluation of new AI tools, frameworks, and methodologies, advocating for the adoption of technologies that align with our strategic goals.



Knowledge & Experience


Experience in leveraging artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies to optimize and transform various aspects of our business operations.
Minimum of 4 years of experience in designing and building AI solutions, with a strong focus on end-to-end automation.
Proven expertise in machine learning techniques, deep learning frameworks, image processing and AI-related technologies including Generative AI.
Experience with one of the cloud platforms, preferably Azure
Experience with Python or PySpark.
Experience in using Data Science Platforms
Experience using the latest Data Science platforms (e.g. Databricks, Dataiku, AzureML, SageMaker ) and frameworks (e.g. Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, scikit-learn )
Good understanding of software architecture patterns & application development.
Familiarity with DevOps,DataOps,MLOps, LLMOps principles including code repository, code management, CI/CD and AI-related automation.
Strong communication skills for both presenting work to clients, disseminating complex information in an easy-to-understand form on a day-to-day basis, and managing stakeholders.
Native speaker in Dutch or French with professional working proficiency in English.



#GetTheFutureYouWant

At Capgemini, we believe in diversity, equal opportunities, and a workplace where everyone feels valued. We take good care of people and help them make progress by assigning challenging projects and providing ample opportunities for personal growth and learning. We are looking for experienced professionals ready for their next career move.

You will join the I&D team, an ambitious, collaborative, supportive environment‚Äîproblem-solvers with a strong focus on exchanging best practices to deliver exceptional results with Data science. Here, the knowledge of each team member and their own expertise is valuable to enable effective decision-making, proactive planning, and smooth project execution.

In return, we offer an attractive salary with fringe benefits:


A hybrid or electric company car (or mobility budget)
Meal & eco vouchers
Group & health insurance
Flexible work hours & the opportunity to work from home (70% of the time)
32 vacation days & 45 workcation days (to work abroad)
Intensive training and certification at all levels to keep you up to date with the latest trends & technologies



Apply now! We'd love to hear from you.

For more information: contact liz.nzimbula@capgemini.com or visit www.capgemini.com

Title: Medior/Senior Data Scientist ‚Äì (Open to freelancers and employees)
Description:
The team, position & mission:




Orange Business Digital Services has been selected to support the Customer Value Management program for a major telecom operator. Our dedicated team includes business analysts, data visualization experts, and customer engagement experts, data scientists‚Ä¶

We are currently looking to fill an open position for a data scientist.







Your key areas of responsibility as a Data Scientist:




Contribute to the development and optimization of models and features related to Customers Value.
Leverage your expertise to seamlessly integrate with the customer's team, adapting swiftly to their well-established MLOps setup, which utilizes frameworks in Vertex AI.
Working autonomously to assist in delivering the backlog efficiently and effectively.




As an ideal candidate you have:




An extensive experience in both supervised and unsupervised machine learning and trained large scale classification models that were then pushed in production and industrialized in a professional environment
An advanced level in SQL
An advanced level in python and ML-specific libraries of python
An advanced ML theoretical background
Any knowledge of GCP (including BigQuery and Vertex AI) is a plus




What we offer you:




Hybrid ways of working with access to our modern & collaborative offices in Brussels
We may work with tomorrow‚Äôs technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification
An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential
A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise
Read more about the benefits we offer here




About Orange Business:




Orange Business is a leading network and digital integrator company with offices in 65 countries worldwide, and part of the Orange Group.

In Europe the business line consists of approximately 1500 people distributed across 9 countries. We are digital natives, with innovation at the core of our business, which makes us a reliable partner close to our customers. Our joint mission is to help innovate, drive and lead them in their digital transformation challenges and business strategies in key digital domains, including Cloud, Customer Experience, Digital Workspace and Data & AI. As an agile and fast-moving digital business partner, the business line offers trusted end-to-end solutions and products that help businesses in a wide range of industries in the private and public sector transform their operations, enhance customer experience, and drive growth.

WHAT CREAM IS ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency‚Ä¶but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.

Title: Expert Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
ü§ñ The Job

Dataroots specialises in crafting robust AI solutions and platforms across diverse sectors, with a keen focus on DataOps and MLOps. As an Expert Machine Learning Engineer, you'll be an integral part of our dedicated in-house team of AI specialists. Your role entails constructing and refining machine learning models that culminate in resilient, production-ready solutions aimed at optimising company processes.

You possess an unwavering passion for data, adept at unraveling its intricacies to unveil its hidden insights. With extensive experience in handling big data, you excel in developing and implementing a wide spectrum of statistical and machine learning models. Your responsibility extends to meticulously overseeing the performance of your models' output, constantly striving to experiment with novel approaches to deliver best-in-class solutions to clients. Collaboration with our data engineers and cloud architects across projects spanning various sectors is paramount, always adhering to a quality-centric, end-to-end approach. The ultimate outcome? Empowering our clients with a dependable foundation for data-driven decision-making




As a senior member, you'll play a pivotal role in fostering knowledge-sharing initiatives within the team. Through a plethora of avenues, you'll actively contribute to disseminating expertise while staying abreast of the latest advancements in the field.




üéâ What you can expect at Dataroots

Dataroots was founded in 2016 and, since its beginnings, has focused on helping its customers achieve excellence in their data-driven operations. The only way to do this sustainably is by investing in team well-being, diversity, knowledge sharing and customer experience. This quality-first focus has allowed sustained and healthy growth over the years. Join a team where you can have an impact on our growth story. Read up more on our DNA over at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].




üí™ The Skills

You bring these qualities and experiences to the job:

Mastery in Machine Learning, backed by a Master's or Doctorate in a quantitative field.
A profound understanding and strong opinions on software design principles.
Extensive industry experience, with a minimum of 4+ years in machine learning and big data.
Strong theoretical grounding and practical expertise in general machine learning and deep learning.
Excellency in both Python & SQL is a must, with additional familiarity in Scala/R.
Demonstrated proficiency in deploying ML models and expertise in MLOps.
Comprehensive understanding of cloud engineering.
Familiarity with GenAI is a big plus.
Enthusiasm for working with substantial datasets.
Pragmatic problem-solving approach.
Exceptional communication skills, capable of translating complex solutions into lucid explanations.
Thorough comprehension of the (big) data ecosystem.
Experience in the consultancy sector is a big plus.
Fluency in English. Speaking Dutch or French fluently is a big plus.
You have EU citizenship or a permanent VISA.




üí∞ The Offer

An attractive salary package with extralegal benefits such as a company car & fuel card or mobility budget, hospitalisation insurance, group insurance, and a high-end laptop and a smartphone.
A personal & team training budget to further your professional career.
Your innovation budget to work on cool, educational, challenging and open-source projects within your guild.
Team Buildings, team gatherings to let off steam and be part of our sports initiatives.




üáßüá™ Our main offices are in Leuven, Ghent and Utrecht üá≥üá±, with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These locations are always available for brainstorming sessions or team events. As a Dataroots consultant, much work can be performed remotely, but you will most likely also visit our clients on-site.




Ready for a new chapter as an Expert Machine Learning Engineer at Dataroots? Super! Apply now! üéâ

Title: Data Scientist Power Distribution & Substations
Description:
DE JOB

Digitalisering en automatisering zijn twee grote focuspunten van Infrabel. Ons Meteo-systeem dat elke drie minuten automatisch het niveau van de wisselverwarming berekent op basis van meteorologische gegevens en een expertsysteem, is een van de mooiste en meest innovatieve voorbeelden hiervan.

Als Specialist Data Scientist werk je mee aan het automatiseren van (diagnose)systemen , specifiek in het domein van Substations & Power Distribution, met als doel het meer en meer inzetten op predictief onderhoud, reduceren van de onderhoudslast en het optimaliseren van het energie-verbruik.

Dit Houdt Onder Andere In


Je identificeert de te monitoren of op afstand te besturen installaties. Deze situeren zich in het domein van de sterkstroom / ( vermogen)elektronica bijvoorbeeld : batterijen, schakelaars, kabelnetwerken, laders, wisselrichters, wisselverwarmingsinstallaties.
Op basis van statistieken en checklists bepaal je welke installaties het meeste problemen geven en hoe groot de kans is dat je deze problemen op voorhand kan detecteren.
Je maakt in samenwerking met de technische specialisten voorstellen aan het management over de manier waarop deze problemen kunnen gemonitord of (op afstand) gecorrigeerd worden.
Van zodra het management zijn akkoord geeft over jouw voorstellen, werk je deze ook verder uit. Je bepaalt de interfaces en laat deze communiceren met de bestaande databases/systemen om zo alle nodige data te kunnen verzamelen.
In een latere fase analyseer en correleer je data uit de verschillende bronnen. Zo ga je op zoek naar verbanden in het systeem en leg je linken tussen de data en de fysische realiteit van de assets.
Einddoel van jouw functie is het reduceren van het preventief onderhoud van de assets en gelinkt hieraan het terugdringen van het aantal incidenten. Hierdoor bouw je niet alleen mee aan de automatisatie van Infrabel maar ook aan een veiliger netwerk voor iedereen.
Enerzijds werk je samen in het team Substations & Power Distribution en anderzijds maak je deel uit van een gespecialiseerd team dataverwerving- en analyse. Ook met de collega‚Äôs ICT en meer bepaald Telecom ben je regelmatig in contact.


Het betreft een functie vang Rang 3 en Klasse 6 volgens het New Reward Plan.

JOUW PROFIEL


Je beschikt over een Masterdiploma of gelijkwaardige relevante ervaring.
Je hebt ervaring binnen of affiniteit met √©√©n of meerdere van de volgende domeinen : informatica (programmeren), telecommunicatie, automatisatie (PLC‚Äôs), data science (data modelering/ algoritmes / forecast modellen / artfici√´le intelligentie / geografische data / power(BI)).
Je hebt tenminste een basiskennis van databases en/of programmeren. Een basiskennis elektriciteit is een plus.
Je hebt een affiniteit met IT en kennis SQL.
Je spreekt en schrijft vloeiend in het Nederlands of Frans met minstens een basiskennis van de 2e landstaal.
Je weet jouw communicatiestijl vlot aan te passen in functie van het moment, de situatie, de persoon‚Ä¶ en stemt hierbij jouw boodschap af op de noden, achtergrond en verwachtingen van jouw doelpubliek.
Je draagt actief bij tot het cre√´ren van een goede teamgeest en tot het bereiken van een gezamenlijk resultaat. Hierbij ontwikkel je positieve en effectieve werkrelaties.
Je beschikt over een sterk analytisch vermogen. Je identificeert de verschillende aspecten van dagelijkse problemen en legt hierbij relevante verbanden.
Je bent inventief en een geduldige doorzetter wat vereist is om projecten te realiseren in samenwerking met interne en externe partijen.


Infrabel wil de maatschappelijke diversiteit weerspiegeld zien in haar medewerkers. Jouw talenten en enthousiasme, daar draait het om, niet om je geslacht, leeftijd, origine of beperking.

ONS AANBOD


Een boeiende en afwisselende job
Bij een stabiel bedrijf dat bijdraagt aan een duurzame mobiliteit voor de samenleving
Talrijke opleidings- en doorgroeimogelijkheden: jij bent ondernemer van je eigen carri√®re
Veel flexibiliteit, zodat je zelf de balans tussen werk en priv√© kan bepalen
Een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met verschillende aanvullende voordelen
Gratis reizen met de trein


DE WERKOMGEVING

Infrabel bouwt, onderhoudt en vernieuwt de spoorweginfrastructuur in Belgi√´. Met zo‚Äôn 10.000 medewerkers werken we aan een betrouwbaar en modern spoorwegnet: om de mobiliteitsbehoeften van onze samenleving mee te ontwikkelen en bij te dragen aan een duurzame samenleving.

Bij Infrabel zijn we trots op ons Top Employer certificaat! Het is het resultaat van onze talrijke projecten op vlak van veiligheid en welzijn van onze collega's, maar ook voor ons ambitieus diversiteits- en inclusiebeleid. Telewerken, persoonlijke ontwikkeling, ergonomie, motivatie van het personeel en stressbeheer zijn maar enkele voorbeelden van de thema's waar we dagelijks aan werken.

WELKE STAPPEN DOORLOOP JE?

Solliciteer online > Wij nemen contact met je op > Selectiegesprek > (Medisch onderzoek >) Welkom bij Infrabel!

Heb je een beperking en kunnen redelijke aanpassingen je een vlotte sollicitatie ervaring garanderen? Laat het ons dan weten.

VRAGEN OVER DEZE VACATURE?

Ludovic Myttenaere, HR Talent Advisor | +32 2 432 57 89 | Ludovic.myttenaere@infrabel.be

Vergeet niet een profiel aan te maken via ‚ÄúMijn Profiel‚Äù. Je kan er niet alleen je gegevens aanvullen, maar ook ‚Äújob alerts‚Äù aanmaken volgens jouw interesses. Zo krijg je de nieuwe jobs die bij jou passen als eerste in je mailbox.

Title: Mobile Developer
Description:
On behalf of our client, a renown European institution, we are seeking for a Mobile Developer, willing to join their team in Brussels, Belgium (on-site).


Contractor employment model
No visa/relocation sponsorship provided



A day in the life of a Mobile Developer

As a mobile developer, your day involves designing and implementing web and mobile applications, analyzing and documenting requirements, and developing database schemas. You integrate systems, create prototypes, and maintain applications based on specifications. Additionally, you participate in meetings, perform testing, and contribute to software architecture, ensuring smooth deployment and up-to-date documentation.

Your day-to-day


Architecture, design and implementation of web/mobile applications
Analysis and documentation of requirements following the standards and methodologies established by the contracting authority
Participate in the analysis and design of database schemas/tables/etc
Data analysis and data modelling
Prototyping
Development/maintenance of applications that reflect the specifications
Design and development of architecture components and building blocks
Integration with other applications/systems
Production of technical documentation
Formulation and/or elaboration of test cases/programs
Participate in the deployment and configuration of the system (s)
Participation in meetings with the contracting authority, project teams and user groups
Perform design, development, unit/integration testing and maintenance of software that both follow the reference architecture rules and accurately implement the specifications received in the documents of analysis provided by the business analysts of the project
Contribute to the BPM platform solution architecture, propose innovative new designs and develop prototypes, rollout pilots
Produce and maintain up-to-date the software architecture and components design documentation, development manuals and tutorials to be used by the BPM development community at EC, based on the reference architecture
Prototype development of business processes and maintain BPM reference flows (business processes) to demonstrate the usage of new features/components added to the BPM platform
Provide technical scripts/documents and assistance with deployment and configuration of the system



Requirements


Excellent knowledge of Angular development framework (version 8 or newer)
Excellent knowledge of HTML5 and CSS
Good knowledge of development platforms (e.g. Ionic or a similar one) to develop mobile applications
Excellent knowledge of web (progressive) and/or mobile (native/hybrid) application design and development
Good knowledge of J2EE including Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) and web services
Good knowledge of Application Servers (e.g. Oracle WebLogic Server)
Good knowledge of Relational Database Management Systems (Oracle, Microsoft SQL, etc.)
Good knowledge of continuous delivery and Application Lifecycle Management tools (Bamboo, JIRA, Git, etc.)
Good knowledge of Spring and Spring boot
Ability to cope with fast changing technologies used in mobile application architecture, design and implementation
Very good communication skills
Ability to give efficient presentations to technical and non-technical audience



Benefits


The opportunity to work in a modern environment
A competitive compensation & benefits package
Continuous learning opportunities using the most modern methods (unlimited access to Udemy for Business, ad-hoc trainings)
A personalized development plan for targeted career growth

Title: Robotics Software Engineer ‚Äì Onboard Autonomy
Description:
The Robotics Software and Intelligence (RSI) Division is responsible for the study, design, prototyping and development of state-of-the-art robotics products for our customers.




Position




The position involves engaging in the development of multi-agent mission planning for robotics systems. The successful candidate will be involved in the analysis, simulation, development, and testing of coordinated task and path planning for multi-agent systems, with integration into both offline control centres and onboard robotic platforms for real-time operations.




The position is central to projects spanning marine, terrestrial, and planetary robotics, contributing to applied research initiatives and on European Space Agency (ESA), European Commission (EC), as well as defence and commercial projects.




The successful candidate will be part of the Robotics, Software & Intelligence (RSI) Team.

The candidate will mainly report to the RSI Team Lead.




Location: Sint-Stevens-Woluwe (Brussels Area)
Start date: As of November 2024




Tasks and Responsibilities




Analyse and develop offline and online mission planning techniques composed of goal decomposition, tasks allocation, path/trajectory planning and adaptation to dynamic events using Artificial Intelligence (AI) or optimisation approaches
Develop command, control & intelligence software applications with integrated mission planning
Participate in the end-to-end implementation with testing, integration and optimisation of target robot architecture
Implement the developed technologies in the in-house robotic control centre and integrate them with mobile and underwater robots
Generate the technical documentation required all along the process.




Skills and Experience




MSc or PhD in relevant fields (e.g. AI/Machine Learning, robotics, computer science, software engineering)




Strong theoretical and practical background in:

Classical AI and/or optimisation techniques
Operational research
Planning domain description
Ontology based knowledge representation
Semantic reasoning - applied to multi-robot mission planning paradigms




In addition:

Very strong programming skills (C++, Python) on Linux environment and Git tools
Thorough experience of Software development in ROS and simulation in Gazebo
Strength to cope with schedules and deadlines
Fluent in English, both spoken and written with good skills in technical documentation delivery.




Considered as Assets




Knowledge of OWL, PDDL and other ontology representations
Machine Learning techniques (supervised, unsupervised, reinforcement learning) and Deep Learning via TensorFlow, Keras, etc.
Knowledge of web technologies such as JavaScript, Node.js, HTML5, etc.
Robotics software architectures (design), Robotics Middleware and Networks
Onboard autonomy
Continuous Integration methodologies.




Our Offer




Working within an exceptional sector with Staff located in Belgium, Germany and the Netherlands
A professional and modern working environment with motivated Administrative Staff, Engineers, Astronaut Training Instructors and Scientists coming from all different horizons and countries with a common passion for space and their own expertise
A full-time position with an indefinite contract of employment
A competitive remuneration package and good working conditions
Working from home in part can be a possibility
An individualised training and development programmes.




About Us




Space Applications Services is a Company at the forefront of space technology development and the provision of services for human spaceflight, exploration and earth observation missions. Headquartered in Belgium (Brussels Area), with a research office in the Netherlands and a subsidiary in the USA, the Company provides solutions for both commercial and institutional customers. We work with Clients such as the European Space Agency, the European Commission, governmental and national space agencies as well as the major space industries.

The Company develops payloads, avionics, robotics technology and products, and provides complete mission operations control centre solutions to EN9100 standards.

The Company also provides engineering, science and training services, including astronaut training.

From our headquarters, we are in daily contact with the International Space Station (ISS) ensuring our Customers‚Äô research is successful.




How To Apply




Upload your CV, Motivation Letter and a Reference Letter, to the attention of Mr Shashank Govindaraj.




The candidate shall be eligible to work in the European Union for a couple of years.

Title: Data Scientist, Risk
Description:
Why join us

Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises ‚Äî including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass ‚Äî use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.

Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We‚Äôre committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.

Engineering at Brex

The Engineering team includes Data, IT, Security, and Software, and is responsible for building innovative products and infrastructure for both internal and external users. We have multiple autonomous and collaborative teams who are eager to learn, teach, and constantly improve how things work. Together, we strive to build robust and scalable systems that enable Brex to grow rapidly and help our customers reach their full potential.

Risk Data Science at Brex

In the Risk Data Science team, we leverage data and AI to manage financial risk (fraud, money laundering, and credit), striking a balance between mitigating those risks and creating a positive experience for our customers.

What You‚Äôll Do

Our Data Scientists are responsible for the entire model development lifecycle from conception with stakeholders, developing the model in a notebook, putting it into production, and circling back with stakeholders to make product or strategic decisions.

Responsibilities


Drive Data & AI solutions from inception to deployment to efficiently manage risk
Be responsible for the full machine learning lifecycle: data acquisition, model design, training, productionization, and monitoring
Partner with cross-functional teams (Ops, Engineering, Product, Fraud, Compliance and Credit)


Requirements


4+ years of experience in Data Science/ML roles
Expertise with Python programming, SQL queries, and ML-related frameworks
Previous experience in the Risk domain (Fraud, AML, and/or Credit)
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
English proficiency/fluency, both written and speaking (note: interviews will be conducted in English)
Must be willing to work in office 2 days per week on Wednesday and Thursday, starting September 1st, 2025 when we open our Sao Paulo office

HTML:
Why join us

Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises ‚Äî including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass ‚Äî use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.

Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We‚Äôre committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.

Engineering at Brex

The Engineering team includes Data, IT, Security, and Software, and is responsible for building innovative products and infrastructure for both internal and external users. We have multiple autonomous and collaborative teams who are eager to learn, teach, and constantly improve how things work. Together, we strive to build robust and scalable systems that enable Brex to grow rapidly and help our customers reach their full potential.

Risk Data Science at Brex

In the Risk Data Science team, we leverage data and AI to manage financial risk (fraud, money laundering, and credit), striking a balance between mitigating those risks and creating a positive experience for our customers.

What You‚Äôll Do

Our Data Scientists are responsible for the entire model development lifecycle from conception with stakeholders, developing the model in a notebook, putting it into production, and circling back with stakeholders to make product or strategic decisions.

Responsibilities

  • Drive Data & AI solutions from inception to deployment to efficiently manage risk
  • Be responsible for the full machine learning lifecycle: data acquisition, model design, training, productionization, and monitoring
  • Partner with cross-functional teams (Ops, Engineering, Product, Fraud, Compliance and Credit)

Requirements

  • 4+ years of experience in Data Science/ML roles
  • Expertise with Python programming, SQL queries, and ML-related frameworks
  • Previous experience in the Risk domain (Fraud, AML, and/or Credit)
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • English proficiency/fluency, both written and speaking (note: interviews will be conducted in English)
  • Must be willing to work in office 2 days per week on Wednesday and Thursday, starting September 1st, 2025 when we open our Sao Paulo office

Bonus points

  • Experience working with real-time data sets
  • Experience in the finance industry

Location

  • Must be working in Brazil at the start of role

Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a brex.com domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.

Title: Desenvolvedor Python
Description:
DEIXE-NOS DIZER O QUE NOS TORNA GENU√çNOS‚Ä¶

Procuramos profissionais que queiram se reinventar a cada dia, que queiram enfrentar desafios em seu DNA e que sejam apaixonados por trabalhar com tecnologia/ciberseguran√ßa. Isso nos torna √∫nicos e aut√™nticos.




O que buscamos?

Coleta e Prepara√ß√£o de Dados: Auxiliar na coleta, limpeza e prepara√ß√£o de conjuntos de dados relevantes para o treinamento de modelos de IA, realizar atividades de pr√©-processamento, como normaliza√ß√£o, padroniza√ß√£o e tratamento de valores ausentes.
Explora√ß√£o de Dados: Analisar dados para identificar padr√µes, tend√™ncias e insights que possam guiar o desenvolvimento de modelos de IA.
Desenvolvimento e Treinamento de Modelos: Colaborar com a equipe para desenvolver, implementar e treinar modelos de aprendizado de m√°quina usando bibliotecas como Tensor Flow, Keras, Scikit-Learn, etc; [o uso de bibliotecas de mercado das principais Clouds √© um ponto importante para acelera√ß√£o dos projetos, com r√°pida implementa√ß√£o de POCs e MVPs].
Experimentar diferentes algoritmos e configura√ß√µes para otimizar o desempenho dos modelos.
Avalia√ß√£o de Modelos: Avaliar o desempenho dos modelos utilizando m√©tricas relevantes, como precis√£o, recall, F1-score, AUC, entre outras. Identificar problemas de vi√©s, sobreajuste ou subajuste e tomar medidas corretivas.
Testes e Valida√ß√£o: Realizar testes rigorosos nos modelos implantados para garantir que eles funcionem corretamente em diferentes cen√°rios.
Documenta√ß√£o: Documentar processos, abordagens, decis√µes e resultados dos modelos de maneira clara e organizada.
Resolu√ß√£o de Problemas: Identificar problemas e desafios que podem ser abordados com IA, e propor solu√ß√µes adequadas.




O que √© necess√°rio?

Experi√™ncias com programa√ß√£o em Python;

O que √© desej√°vel?

Desenvolvimento em .Net.

About Translated

Translated is a leading company in AI-enabled translation services. We are on a mission to allow everyone to understand and be understood in their own language.

Our success stems from a unique blend of the world‚Äôs #1 adaptive neural machine translation technology (IDC MarketScape 2022), the largest network of vetted, native-speaking professional translators, and top-ranked AI-enabled text, audio, and video translation tools (Gartner, 2022).

By leveraging a seamless symbiosis of artificial intelligence and human creativity, we design custom localization projects that were previously unthinkable, helping more than 280,000 clients grow their businesses worldwide.

We offer: Data Scientist Internship to join the Translated Data Science and AI Production team in our HQ in Pi Campus, Rome. The candidate will be responsible for building Machine Learning services and analyze company data.

What You‚Äôll Do


Machine Learning Projects such as Classification Models, Text Categorization
Building and maintaining company-wide KPIs
ETL pipelines
Analyze company data to improve process and KPIs


Qualifications Required


MSc in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics
Experience of Python programming, Machine Learning and Data manipulation libraries
Experience in data wrangling, cleaning, exploration, and feature extraction.
Experience with Relational DBMS ( MySQL, PostgreSQL )
Experience with NoSQL DBMS ( Redis, MongoDB )
Experience with version control GIT and Github workflow
Experience in Natural Language Processing (NLP)
Excellent knowledge of Italian, English and preferably another language.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Ability to rapidly define ideas and solutions, develop critical analyses, and use creative approaches to solve complex problems.


Headquarter

Translated is hosted at Pi Campus, a working environment immersed in nature where 5 luxury villas have been converted into functional offices to foster talent growth. Pi Campus is also a venture firm created by Translated to reinvest part of its profits into promising AI startups.

Title: Junior Responsible AI Data Scientist
Description:
Skill Farm Members are invited to apply for the following role, the description is shown below:

Responsibilities:

supportare lo sviluppo di progetti end-to-end su temi di Responsible AI come la mitigazione dei bias, l'explainability, la protezione dei dati, la robustezza contro attacchi avversari e l'interazione uomo-AI;

sviluppare nuovi modelli, algoritmi e metodi che incorporino i principi di Responsible AI nella progettazione e distribuzione dei sistemi di AI;

lavorare a stretto contatto con i team di data science per tradurre i risultati della ricerca in applicazioni pratiche e prototipi;

comunicare e diffondere le migliori pratiche sull'implementazione della Responsible AI a stakeholder interni ed esterni;

mantenere un aggiornamento costante sulle ultime ricerche e tendenze nella Responsible AI e nei campi correlati;

collaborare strettamente con il team di AI etica e tradurre i requisiti legali in requisiti tecnici.

Skills & Qualifications:

Esperienza nella ricerca sulla Responsible AI

Conoscenza di Python.

Esperienza con framework e strumenti di apprendimento automatico come TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn o Keras.

Passione per la creazione di un impatto sociale positivo con l'AI

Esperienze con le principali tecniche di modellizzazione statistiche e di machine learning.

Esperienze di bias assessment, mitigazione dei bias e realizzazione di sistemi di explainability.

Esperienze con i processi di versionamento del software (es. Git).

Esperienze con Containers e Platform come Service (RH Openshift).

Esperienze nelle tecnologie per la gestione dei dati.

Title: Junior Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Smart-I S.r.l, a Maggioli group company, is a fresh and dynamic company developing products with Computer Vision and A.I. technology for Smart Cities, Smart Industries, and Smart Retail. We're on the cusp of something that is world-changing and we're looking for someone to join our talented team. This is for a position at our Rome office settled at Tecnopolo Tiburtino.




Your contribution:

As an Artificial Intelligence Junior, you will be in charge of designing and developing the brand-new artificial intelligence algorithms to be hosted on our embedded board as well as on our cloud infrastructure.




[ Some of your responsibilities include ]

Designing & developing machine/deep learning algorithms and edge computing techniques
Design & implementation of computer vision algorithms.
Data analysis & manipulation for training, validation, and testing.




[ Your skills ]




Required

Extensive programming experience in Python
Extensive knowledge of OpenCV and Image Manipulation
Extensive knowledge of TensorFlow/PyTorch libraries
Good in English (written & spoken)
Good knowledge of Linux OS




Preferred

Experience in C++ programming
Experience in multi-core programming and optimization
Experience with AI Accelerators
Experience in code versioning (Git)
Experience in AWS and GCP Environment




[ Education ]

MSc in Computer Science / Artificial Intelligence / Engineering / Robotics




[ Our offer ]

Young and passionate team
Flexible working time and informal working environment
Hybrid working
Challenging and exciting work
Merit-based approach
Show more

Smart-I S.r.l, a Maggioli group company, is a fresh and dynamic company developing products with Computer Vision and A.I. technology for Smart Cities, Smart Industries, and Smart Retail. We're on the cusp of something that is world-changing and we're looking for someone to join our talented team. This is for a position at our Rome office settled at Tecnopolo Tiburtino.


Your contribution:

As an Artificial Intelligence Junior, you will be in charge of designing and developing the brand-new artificial intelligence algorithms to be hosted on our embedded board as well as on our cloud infrastructure.


[ Some of your responsibilities include ]

  • Designing & developing machine/deep learning algorithms and edge computing techniques
  • Design & implementation of computer vision algorithms.
  • Data analysis & manipulation for training, validation, and testing.


[ Your skills ]


Required

  • Extensive programming experience in Python
  • Extensive knowledge of OpenCV and Image Manipulation
  • Extensive knowledge of TensorFlow/PyTorch libraries
  • Good in English (written & spoken)
  • Good knowledge of Linux OS


Preferred

  • Experience in C++ programming
  • Experience in multi-core programming and optimization
  • Experience with AI Accelerators
  • Experience in code versioning (Git)
  • Experience in AWS and GCP Environment

MSc in Computer Science / Artificial Intelligence / Engineering / Robotics
