  • Young and passionate team
  • Flexible working time and informal working environment
  • Hybrid working
  • Challenging and exciting work
  • Merit-based approach

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Cosa Ti Proponiamo

All‚Äôinterno della divisione Pubblica Amministrazione e Sanit√† nell‚Äôarea di mercato Pubblica Amministrazione Locale ‚Äì Centro di Competenza Agricoltura, Ambiente, Territorio e Osservazione della Terra siamo alla ricerca di una figura di Data Scientist.

Quali saranno le tue attivit√† e responsabilit√†?


Intervenire a supporto della Direzione Tecnica nella fase di proposta delle soluzioni progettuali, illustrando le potenzialit√† delle soluzioni GIS e delle tecniche di geospatial analytics, mettendoli in relazione alle esigenze del cliente. A tal fine partecipa attivamente a riunioni di prevendita, prepara presentazioni, conduce la realizzazione di Proof of Concept e collabora nella fase di predisposizione di offerte.
Definire l'architettura tecnica del sistema con cui effettuare analisi in applicazioni GIS, che comprendono: attivit√† di data preparation, per la messa a disposizione di dati grezzi oggetto di analisi; data pre-processing, per la trasformazione dei dati grezzi in formato idoneo per l'esecuzione di logiche di mining; progettazione ed esecuzione dei processi di analisi avanzata, per estrarre informazione nascosta e conoscenza e di lettura e interpretazione dei risultati tramite specifiche pipelines ed ETL, per spiegare come l'informazione trovata risponde alle domande iniziali.
Definire le specifiche di analisi funzionale e tecnica dei requisiti dell'utente, attraverso la redazione di specifiche tecniche per il gruppo di sviluppo e/o di system integration.
Interagire con le diverse figure che svolgono attivit√† in questo ambito: esperti di dominio, analisti dati, architetti di sistemi informatici e specialisti di prodotto.
Controllare e realizzare procedure di disegno e progettazione di test funzionali, test di integrazione, di sicurezza, usabilit√†, accessibilit√†, e test di carico;
Supportare le attivit√† di change management per guidare il cliente ad usare le metodologie e il sistema analitico predisposto, conducendo attivit√† formative e di consulenza.


Qualifiche e Competenze Richieste


Abilit√† nel raccogliere informazioni per comprendere rapidamente le necessit√† del cliente e proporre soluzioni efficaci ed innovative.
Progettazione funzionale di framework back end e front end per la gestione di dati geospaziali anche in ottica Cloud (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS).
Ottima conoscenza di DBMS relazionali per la gestione di dati geospaziali (ad esempio PostgreSQL/PostGIS).
Ottima conoscenza di soluzioni di Map Server per la gestione e la pubblicazione di dati geospaziali su applicazioni Web (ad esempio Geoserver).
Buona conoscenza degli strumenti per l‚Äôelaborazione di dati geospaziali (raster e vettoriali) che utilizzino librerie open source Python, Javascript, R, etc. (ad esempio: QGIS, GRASS, SAGA, GDAL, Turf.js, ORFEO Toolbox, R Spatial, etc.)
Buona conoscenza degli standard tecnologici e normativi per la progettazione di architetture GIS Open source (Open Geospatial Consortium - OGC, ISO, INSPIRE).
Buona conoscenza di librerie e framework per la realizzazione di applicazioni Web per la gestione dei dati geospaziali (OpenLayers, Leaflet, Turf.js, HTML5 gi√† dotate di funzionalit√† BI).
Ottima conoscenza delle procedure di pre-processing e processing avanzato dei dati di Osservazione della Terra (dati satellitari), in particolare per i dati open prodotti all'interno del programma Copernicus (Sentinel-1, Sentinel-2, e opzionalmente anche Sentinel-3 e Sentinel-5P).


Per il suddetto profilo, sono considerati elementi di valore aggiunto le seguenti competenze:


Esperienza nel disegno e realizzazione di architetture GIS Open Source conformi agli standard OGC e redazione di documenti di analisi dei requisiti funzionali su progetti di Sistemi Informativi Territoriali per organizzazioni di grandi dimensioni (ad esempio Pubbliche Amministrazioni regionali o grandi imprese).
Esperienza nella progettazione funzionale di cruscotti e strumenti di Business Intelligence per la fruibilit√† e gestione dei dati geospaziali (GeoBI).
Buona conoscenza dei principali algoritmi di Machine Learning utilizzati per l'analisi dei dati geospaziali, ed in particolare per dati satellitari (supervised & non supervised classification, segmentation & Object-Based Image Analysis, etc.) e dei principali software GIS per la loro implementazione ed utilizzo, sia open source che commerciali (alcuni esempi: QGIS, SNAP, Rspatial, TensorFlow, ERDAS, ENVI, etc.).


Cosa cerchiamo nelle nostre persone?


Ambizione, nel perseguire grandi obiettivi e nell'investire sul miglioramento continuo;
Proattivit√†, nell‚Äôanticipare e affrontare le sfide con iniziativa;
Trasparenza, nel comunicare apertamente e fornire feedback costruttivi;
Motivazione a migliorare e a crescere insieme agli altri, manifestando apertura al confronto per favorire la crescita collettiva e il raggiungimento degli obiettivi comuni.


Invia la tua candidatura e raccontaci come puoi fare la differenza.

SEDI DI INSERIMENTO

Tutte le principali sedi di Italia dove Engineering √® presente, come:

Roma | Milano | Torino | Bologna | Palermo | Napoli | Firenze | Genova | Padova

L‚Äôannuncio √® rivolto a tutti i candidati, senza distinzione di sesso, nel rispetto del Codice delle pari opportunit√† di cui al D.Lgs. 198/2006 e ss.mm.ii.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About Translated

Translated is a leading company in AI-enabled translation services. We are on a mission to allow everyone to understand and be understood in their own language.

Our success stems from a unique blend of the world‚Äôs #1 adaptive neural machine translation technology (IDC MarketScape 2022), the largest network of vetted, native-speaking professional translators, and top-ranked AI-enabled text, audio, and video translation tools (Gartner, 2022).

By leveraging a seamless symbiosis of artificial intelligence and human creativity, we design custom localization projects that were previously unthinkable, helping more than 280,000 clients grow their businesses worldwide.

We‚Äôre looking for a passionate Machine Learning Engineer to join the Translated Data Science and AI Production team in our HQ in Pi Campus, Rome. The persona will be responsible for building and maintaining the Machine Learning and AI services of the company.




Key responsabilities

Lead the development of Machine Learning services
Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines
Improve and maintain our GPU cluster
Improve and maintain our API ecosystem
Optimize and put in production Machine Learning models
Collaborate with other team members on internal and external models
Coding, debugging and testing
Build high-quality reusable code that can be used in the future
Develop functional and sustainable applications with clean codes
Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of product owners, designers, developers and system administrators
Collaborate with the ModernMT and Research teams to create the best Translation Engine ever.




Requirements

Master degree in Computer Science or SW Engineering courses
3+ years of working experience

Deep Knowledge of Python, Java and Bash
Experience with Kubernetes and Docker
Experience with Relational DBMS ( MySQL, PostgreSQL )

Proactive, self-driven and enjoys solving complex problems, not just in the primary area of responsibility but across boundaries.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
NTT DATA, √® tra i principali player a livello mondiale in ambito IT services. Con pi√π di 151.000 professionisti in oltre 50 Paesi in tutto il mondo, siamo protagonisti e acceleratori della trasformazione digitale offrendo ai nostri clienti soluzioni tecnologiche e innovative progettate su misura. Il motore di NTTDATA sono le persone, ognuna con la propria unicit√†, talento ed attitudine. Isa Digital Consulting √® una societ√† indipendente che opera da 30 anni nella consulenza, specializzata in ICT Strategy & Architecture, Digital Solution e Human Resources. Conoscenza dei principali tool di Data Visualization (tra cui Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, SAS) e delle principali tecnologie legate ai Big Data come Hadoop, MapReduce, Spark
Comprensione delle tecniche e delle architetture di Data Warehousing
Esperienza nella programmazione e scripting
Competenza nell'utilizzo dei principali strumenti di analisi dei dati, come R, Python, SQL, NoSQ
Padronanza delle principali tecniche di Data Modelling ed Machine Learning







Nice to have




Esperienza nell'elaborazione di dati nel settore Cultura

Title: ML Engineer Senior
HTML:
NTT DATA, Trusted Global Innovator, √® tra i principali player a livello mondiale in ambito IT services. Con pi√π di 140.000 professionisti in oltre 50 Paesi in tutto il mondo, siamo protagonisti e acceleratori della trasformazione digitale offrendo ai nostri clienti soluzioni tecnologiche e innovative progettate su misura. Il motore di NTTDATA sono le persone, ognuna con la propria unicit√†, talento ed attitudine. Abbiamo costruito una Smile Working Company in cui la cura, l‚Äôascolto delle persone, il loro benessere e sviluppo delle competenze sono la nostra priorit√†. Abbiamo creato spazi di lavoro che favoriscono il senso di comunit√† e lo scambio costruttivo di esperienze.

Guardiamo al nostro domani con la stessa passione di ieri e abbiamo bisogno anche del tuo talento!

www.nttdata.com/it

Responsibilities

The ideal candidate as Senior Machine Learning Engineer in NTT DATA will have a solid Generative AI hands-on capability (preferably on Azure/GCP and on-premise GenAI architecture and MLops), mathematical background, experience working on a range of classification, informational retrieval, clustering, and optimization problems, establishing scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analysis, model development, model validation and model implementation.

The Senior Machine Learning Engineer will work alongside experienced Data Scientists, Data and ML Engineers to identify business opportunities, design and create new data pipelines from scratch, from experiments to deploying them in production.

He/She will be responsible for multiple projects, leading the ML Engineers and connecting with the stakeholders.

Required Skills

  • At least 5 years of production experience working in Data Science or Software Engineering;
  • Deep knowledge of math, probability, statistics and algorithms;
  • At least 6/12 months of experience in Generative AI deployment and underlying architecture handling;
  • Vector Database knowledge is well appreciated;
  • Understanding of data structures, data modeling and software architecture;
  • Fluent in a at least two mainstream programming language (Python, Scala, Java, C++);
  • Experience in building an infrastructure for technical users, such as Data Scientist, ML practitioners or data consumers/producers;
  • Strong knowledge of Spark, Databricks is a strong plus;
  • Experience developing/deploying ML solutions in one of the public cloud platforms and on a Cross-cloud base, Snowflake knowledge is a plus;
  • Deep knowledge with machine learning frameworks (such as Keras or PyTorch);
  • Ability to design and implement machine learning pipelines in a production environment;
  • Experience with deployment including knowledge of CI/CD, containerization, and related concepts with a focus over MLops/Re-Training/Drift Management;
  • Ability to train more junior team members in multiple Machine Learning and Deep Learning concepts;
  • Establish and maintain strong relationships with internal team members and external clients


Location: Milano, Bari, Bologna, Cosenza, Napoli, Pisa, Roma, Torino

Title: Data Scientist Senior
HTML:
NTT DATA, Trusted Global Innovator, √® tra i principali player a livello mondiale in ambito IT services. Con pi√π di 140.000 professionisti in oltre 50 Paesi in tutto il mondo, siamo protagonisti e acceleratori della trasformazione digitale offrendo ai nostri clienti soluzioni tecnologiche e innovative progettate su misura. Guardiamo al nostro domani con la stessa passione di ieri e abbiamo bisogno anche del tuo talento!

www.nttdata.com/it

Responsibilities

The ideal candidate as Senior Data Scientist in NTT DATA will have a mix of skills including Generative AI hands-on capability (preferably on Azure/GCP and on-premise) engineering best practices, statistical expertise, Machine and Deep Learning skills and a strong business sense.

The Senior Data Scientist will work with fellow data scientists, data engineers, ML Engineers, product managers, business analysts, and stakeholders from other internal groups and from external clients.

He/She will be responsible for multiple projects, leading the Data Scientists and connecting with the stakeholders on client?s side, to ensure that tasks are on time and well executed.

Required Skills

  • Experience of at least 3-5 years as data scientist;
  • Strong Python (mandatory) and SQL coding;
  • Knowledge of Java/Scala or C++/R is a plus;
  • Tensorflow and Pytorch knowledge with a focus over Computer Vision solutions;
  • Knowledge of ML solutions architecture and Generative AI pipelines;
  • Cloud and hybrid ML implementations;
  • Incorporate new, cutting edge business intelligence, machine learning, and alternative data practices into wider organization to drive efficiencies and generate revenue;
  • Own the full stack execution of data science projects from data wrangling, model development, presentation, measurement to deployment;
  • Work with data engineers to produce fully productionized pipelines including data ingestion, cleaning, feature engineering and model training/prediction;
  • Conduct research and analysis into reinsurance and advisory products to augment industry-standard models and develop new market offerings;
  • Establish and maintain strong relationships with internal team members and external clients


Location: Milano, Bari, Bologna, Cosenza, Napoli, Roma, Salerno, Torino

Title: (Senior) Data Scientist - Relocation to Brussels
HTML:
We are looking for a (Senior) Data Scientist for an International Institution in Brussels, Belgium.


EU candidates are welcome to apply. Candidates need to be willing to relocate.


A work permit is required. This position is open for contractors. Candidates need to be fluent in English.


Tasks and responsibilities:

  • Collect business requirement and develop advanced data mining solutions or identify, assess and deploy relevant existing data mining, machine learning and business intelligence solutions;
  • Specification and design of presentation interfaces with optimal usability/user experience.
  • Identify, collect, convert and update different data types/sets in several locations (e.g. ETL).
  • Produces data models according to specific problems statements;
  • Scripting and programming;
  • Contribute to the design and implementation of the analytics architecture and its solution stack (including performance aspects, physical design, capacity dimensions etc...);
  • Write the different documentation associated with the tasks and liaise with other project teams as necessary to address cross-project interdependencies;


Profile:

  • Master degree in a relevant discipline (such as; Data Science, Mathematics/Statistics, Computer Science or Engineering);
  • +9 years of Data Scientist experience;
  • Very good knowledge of the involved Mathematics and Statistics (Linear algebra, Calculus, Probability theory, Statistics, hypothesis testing, Optimization techniques, etc.);
  • Very good knowledge of programming in Python and/or R;
  • Very good experience with data manipulation: Analysis techniques, ability to clean, pre-process, and transform data;
  • Very good experience with data visualization using tools like Matplotlib, etc;
  • Very good knowledge of ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and techniques;
  • Hands-on experience with various machine learning algorithms, including supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning;
  • Experience with model evaluation, selection and validation techniques;
  • Knowledge of deep learning and neural networks;
  • Experience with RDBMS like Oracle (latest version);
  • Understanding of NoSQL databases like MongoDB or Cassandra;
  • Knowledge of NLP techniques and libraries like NLTK, spaCy, or Transformers;
  • Awareness of involved ethical considerations in data collection and analysis;
  • Knowledge of applicable data privacy laws and regulations;
  • Ability to give business and technical presentations;
  • Ability to apply high quality standards;
  • Ability to cope with fast changing technologies used in the domain of Data Science;
  • Fluent in English;


Interested:

Please send your resume to resume@all-european-careers.com.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
InfoCert is the largest Certificate Authority in Europe and a leading provider of trust-based business solutions for organizations and businesses to interact online with customers and citizens, in full compliance with EU laws. InfoCert is bringing its leading-edge patented technologies to the European and LatAm markets to accelerate the achievement of a full digital society.

InfoCert is part of Tinexta Group, an industrial Group that offers innovative solutions for the digital transformation and growth of companies, professionals and institutions. Based in Italy and present in 9 countries across Europe and Latin America with more than 2,000 employees, Tinexta is active in the strategic sectors of Digital Trust, Cyber Security and Business Innovation.

Posizione:

InfoCert is looking for AI Engineer.

Service Innovation is the unit with the task to align products evolution and R&D activities to InfoCert business strategy. From incremental innovation to high level design of radical business model changes, Service Innovation coverage spans the three innovation horizons:


Relevant product evolution - roadmaps and budgeting (3-6 months horizon)
New products, concepts, design, and prototypes (6-12 months horizon)
R&D activities and financed projects (>12 months horizon


Requisiti:


Oversee the design, development, and deployment of AI solutions from concept to production.
Actively contribute to the AI Lab initiatives by developing new AI solutions, researching new technologies, and staying updated with the latest advancements in the field.
Provide AI expertise and support to various teams across the company. Understand their requirements, propose suitable AI solutions, and assist in implementing these solutions to solve business problems.
Prepare and deliver talks, demos, and proofs of concept (PoCs) to showcase AI solutions to internal teams, stakeholders, and clients.


Altre informazioni:


Demonstrated experience in designing, developing, and deploying AI and machine learning models.
Familiarity with frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn is essential.
Experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure. The ability to design and implement scalable AI solutions using cloud services, including but not limited to AI/ML toolkits, data storage, and deployment mechanisms.
Proven ability to lead and manage AI projects from conception to deployment. Experience with agile methodologies and tools for version control, project tracking, and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD).
Proficiency in one or more programming languages commonly used in AI development, such as Python, Java, or JavaScript.
Experience with large language models like GPT, BERT, or similar architectures.
Ability to fine-tune and deploy LLMs for various natural language processing tasks, including text generation, summarization, translation, and question-answering.
Experience with frameworks such as LangChain and Hugging Face Transformers for developing and managing AI pipelines, expertise in creating and utilizing embeddings for various NLP tasks, hands-on experience with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) architectures for integrating retrieval mechanisms with language models, proficiency in fine-tuning pre-trained models to enhance performance for specific tasks, and knowledge of vector databases like Faiss, Milvus, or Pinecone for efficient storage and querying of embeddings.


Sede di lavoro: Milano, Padova, Roma

Title: Construction Data Scientist
Description:
About Us

JOB DESCRIPTION

At Technip Energies, we believe in a better tomorrow, and we believe we can make tomorrow better. With approximately 15,000 talented women and men, we are a global and leading engineering and technology company, with a clear vision to accelerate the energy transition. Designing and delivering added value energy solutions is what we do. If you share our determination to drive the transition to a low-carbon future, then this could be the job for you. We are currently seeking a Construction Data Scientist, reporting directly to the Global Construction Data Innovation Manager in Rome to join our Construction Data Science team based in Paris (France) and Rome (Italy).

About The Job

The Global Construction Data Innovation (GCDI) is part of Global Construction, within Delivery Excellence division, and aims to develop and improve digital solutions, data science solutions (data analytics and AI), data accessibility and bi reporting for better estimating, preparing & controlling construction activities with the target to optimize construction resources, costs & duration.

The Construction Data Scientist will be part of the Construction Data Science team.

He/She will have mathematical and statistical expertise, along with natural curiosity and a creative mind. While mining and interpreting, and cleaning T.EN data, this person will be relied on to ask questions, connect the dots, and uncover hidden opportunities for realizing the data‚Äôs full potential.

He/She will support projects all around the globe to use their data as best as possible to create value and improve the management at site.

He/She will work on data produced from past construction projects for identifying benchmarking and construction patterns to optimize construction execution.

He/She will produce digital solutions to make construction management taking data driven decisions.

He/She will be at the interface between site teams, CMC teams, Data Office teams and IDS teams.

He/She will be part of the CMC team and will strive to continuously improve the performance of construction at site.

Construction Data Scientist will be performing the following task:


Enable smarter business processes by using analytics for meaningful insights to help solve problems across various domains and industries.
Analyze data to identify patterns and trends to deliver recommendations for the future.
Visualization: develop data visualization and storytelling solutions.
Business Understanding: collaborate with businesses to understand their needs and identify use cases to develop.
IT understanding: collaborate with IT and Data Office for understanding the data frame where develop, deploy, and run digital and data science products.
Data Understanding: analyze data for exploring data characteristics and their alignment with business use case.
Data Preparation: interact with Data Engineering to set up the data sources and all steps of dataset preparation.
Modelling & Validation: develop modelling methodology, features engineering, implement model, follow up model training and its validation, and definition of efficient model to deploy.
Monitoring: monitoring and fine tuning of the model developed
Deployment: interact with IT and Data Office for deployment and industrialization of data science and digital solutions developed
Communicate findings to all stakeholders.
Prepare and deliver documentation, training and webinar about data science.
Staying up to date with the latest advancements in AI and scripting language.



We offer you not only a job, but an inspiring journey in a truly global environment where you team up to break down boundaries thanks to the innovation, creativity and pioneer spirit which drive our people.

About You

We‚Äôd love to hear from you if your profile meets the following essential requirements:

Qualifications:


Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering (preference for IT and mechanical engineering), or Computer Science or Mathematical



Languages: English fluent

Main Skills:


Analytical thinking for translating data into descriptive, predictive and prescriptive analytics and products.
Story telling mindset.
Very good communication skills to identify the business requirements and to expose findings to all stakeholders.
Able to interface with IT and Data Office for understanding the data framework of data science projects.
Able to associate more efficient Machine Learning models to a specific business use case.
Able to identify algorithm metrics and monitoring system.
Data science curious, open mind and updated to data science state of art.
Ability to think creatively and strategically with excellent problem-solving skills..
Able to manage more than one activity at the same time.
Attitude to perform the work in team, in an international and multi-cultural environment.
Ability to fulfil tasks on time with the required Company quality level
Able to work and deliver in an incremental approach
Availability to international mobility either for short- or long-term assignment



Technical Competencies:


Knowledge of data mining, mathematics, and statistical analysis
Knowledge of SQL (from a data scientist perspective, not necessarily dev or data engineering)
Knowledge of Scripting Language (e.g., Python, R, Julia) and data science libraries
Knowledge of main Machine Learning models (supervised and unsupervised)
Knowledge of data pipelines, cleansing and data preparation
Knowledge of Statistical computing package (e.g, R) is a plus
Knowledge of NLP, LLM is a plus
Knowledge of Agile, Git, DevOps and MLOps is a plus
Knowledge of BI and visualization tools (e.g, PowerBI) is a plus

HTML:
About Us

 JOB DESCRIPTION

At Technip Energies, we believe in a better tomorrow, and we believe we can make tomorrow better. With approximately 15,000 talented women and men, we are a global and leading engineering and technology company, with a clear vision to accelerate the energy transition. Designing and delivering added value energy solutions is what we do. If you share our determination to drive the transition to a low-carbon future, then this could be the job for you. We are currently seeking a Construction Data Scientist, reporting directly to the Global Construction Data Innovation Manager in Rome to join our Construction Data Science team based in Paris (France) and Rome (Italy).

About The Job

The Global Construction Data Innovation (GCDI) is part of Global Construction, within Delivery Excellence division, and aims to develop and improve digital solutions, data science solutions (data analytics and AI), data accessibility and bi reporting for better estimating, preparing & controlling construction activities with the target to optimize construction resources, costs & duration.

The Construction Data Scientist will be part of the Construction Data Science team.

He/She will have mathematical and statistical expertise, along with natural curiosity and a creative mind. While mining and interpreting, and cleaning T.EN data, this person will be relied on to ask questions, connect the dots, and uncover hidden opportunities for realizing the data‚Äôs full potential.

He/She will support projects all around the globe to use their data as best as possible to create value and improve the management at site.

He/She will work on data produced from past construction projects for identifying benchmarking and construction patterns to optimize construction execution.

He/She will produce digital solutions to make construction management taking data driven decisions.

He/She will be at the interface between site teams, CMC teams, Data Office teams and IDS teams.

He/She will be part of the CMC team and will strive to continuously improve the performance of construction at site.

Construction Data Scientist will be performing the following task:

  • Enable smarter business processes by using analytics for meaningful insights to help solve problems across various domains and industries.
  • Analyze data to identify patterns and trends to deliver recommendations for the future.
  • Visualization: develop data visualization and storytelling solutions.
  • Business Understanding: collaborate with businesses to understand their needs and identify use cases to develop.
  • IT understanding: collaborate with IT and Data Office for understanding the data frame where develop, deploy, and run digital and data science products.
  • Data Understanding: analyze data for exploring data characteristics and their alignment with business use case.
  • Data Preparation: interact with Data Engineering to set up the data sources and all steps of dataset preparation.
  • Modelling & Validation: develop modelling methodology, features engineering, implement model, follow up model training and its validation, and definition of efficient model to deploy.
  • Monitoring: monitoring and fine tuning of the model developed
  • Deployment: interact with IT and Data Office for deployment and industrialization of data science and digital solutions developed
  • Communicate findings to all stakeholders.
  • Prepare and deliver documentation, training and webinar about data science.
  • Staying up to date with the latest advancements in AI and scripting language.


We offer you not only a job, but an inspiring journey in a truly global environment where you team up to break down boundaries thanks to the innovation, creativity and pioneer spirit which drive our people.

About You

We‚Äôd love to hear from you if your profile meets the following essential requirements:

Qualifications:

  • Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering (preference for IT and mechanical engineering), or Computer Science or Mathematical


Languages: English fluent

Main Skills:

  • Analytical thinking for translating data into descriptive, predictive and prescriptive analytics and products.
  • Story telling mindset.
  • Very good communication skills to identify the business requirements and to expose findings to all stakeholders.
  • Able to interface with IT and Data Office for understanding the data framework of data science projects.
  • Able to associate more efficient Machine Learning models to a specific business use case.
  • Able to identify algorithm metrics and monitoring system.
  • Data science curious, open mind and updated to data science state of art.
  • Ability to think creatively and strategically with excellent problem-solving skills..
  • Able to manage more than one activity at the same time.
  • Attitude to perform the work in team, in an international and multi-cultural environment.
  • Ability to fulfil tasks on time with the required Company quality level
  • Able to work and deliver in an incremental approach
  • Availability to international mobility either for short- or long-term assignment


Technical Competencies:

  • Knowledge of data mining, mathematics, and statistical analysis
  • Knowledge of SQL (from a data scientist perspective, not necessarily dev or data engineering)
  • Knowledge of Scripting Language (e.g., Python, R, Julia) and data science libraries
  • Knowledge of main Machine Learning models (supervised and unsupervised)
  • Knowledge of data pipelines, cleansing and data preparation
  • Knowledge of Statistical computing package (e.g, R) is a plus
  • Knowledge of NLP, LLM is a plus
  • Knowledge of Agile, Git, DevOps and MLOps is a plus
  • Knowledge of BI and visualization tools (e.g, PowerBI) is a plus
  • Knowledge of Dataiku and Synapse are a plus


Knowledge of Construction work processes is a plus

Inclusion Standards

In our continuous journey to developing and building culture of inclusion, we adhere to four Inclusion Gold Standards. And you?

  • We challenge our biases and embrace diversity of thought ;
  • No one has all the knowledge and solutions, collectively we do ;
  • We foster a caring environment where people are respected, comfortable to share and be heard ;
  • We promote active listening for effective decision and action.


What‚Äôs Next?

Starting Date:

Once receiving your system application, Recruiting Team will screen and match your skills, experience, and potential team fit against the role requirements. We ask for your patience as the team completes the volume of applications with reasonable timeframe. Check your application progress periodically via personal account from created candidate profile during your application.

The exceptional EY experience, it‚Äôs yours to build!

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Roma
HTML:
Senior Data Scientist

Management consulting - Lighthouse

Roma

Lighthouse, centro di eccellenza di KPMG Advisory, si concentra sul fornire soluzioni tecnologiche all'avanguardia, tra cui algoritmi di AdvanceAnalytics e Intelligenza Artificiale in diversi settori. Siamo specializzati nelle tecnologie Data-Driven e stiamo cercando un Senior Data Scientist di talento con esperienza nell'elaborazione del linguaggio naturale (NLP) e nell'AI generativa.

  • Integrazione dei dati: Identificare ed elaborare importanti fonti di dati per supportare strumenti e metodologie Data-Driven;
  • Modellazione: Sviluppare e adattare modelli di intelligenza artificiale per rispondere a specifici requisiti aziendali;

  • Comunicazione aziendale: Condividere i dettagli del progetto con gli utenti aziendali per creare fiducia e spiegare le metodologie;
  • Sviluppo del team: Fare da mentore ai nuovi membri del team per migliorare le loro competenze e la loro crescita come Data Scientist e MLOps Engineer.

Il candidato lavorer√† con le seguenti tecnologie:

  • Linguaggi di programmazione: Python (& PySpark);
  • Librerie e framework: NLTK, SpaCy, Keras, PyTorch;
  • Gen AI: OpenAI, Claude, modelli di hugging-face;
  • Piattaforme: Hugging Face, Github;
  • Distribuzione dei modelli: Flask, MLFlow;
  • Cloud: Azure.

Il candidato ideale deve soddisfare i seguenti requisiti:

  • Conoscenza di Python;
  • Buona conoscenza di come progettare e organizzare un Modello di Dati;
  • Buona conoscenza di come rappresentare i risultati graficamente;
  • Buona conoscenza del Cloud;
  • Inglese avanzato;
  • Almeno 3 anni di esperienza di lavoro su progetti di Advanced Analytics.

I dati richiesti saranno gestiti nel rispetto del Decreto Legislativo Europeo n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - "GDPR") e successive modifiche o integrazioni. Per maggiori informazioni si rimanda alla Privacy Policy di KPMG. KPMG Advisory S.p.A. √® un datore di lavoro che rispetta le pari opportunit√†.

Senior Data Scientist

Management Consulting ‚Äì Lighthouse

Rome

Lighthouse, KPMG Advisory‚Äôs center of excellence, focuses on delivering cutting-edge Technology solutions, including Advanced Analytics & Artificial Intelligence algothms across various industries. We specialize in Data-Driven Technologies and are seeking a talented Senior Data Scientist with expertise in Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Generative AI.

The job‚Äôs main activities will be the following:

  • Data Integration: Identify and process important data sources to support Data-Driven tools and methodologies;
  • Modeling: Develop and Adapt Artificial Intelligence models to address specific business requirements;
  • Advanced Analytics Platforms: Build complete ML pipelines from data ingestion to frontend applications;
  • Business Communication: Share project details with business users to build trust and explain methodologies;

The candidate will work with the following technologies:

  • Gen AI: OpenAI, Claude, hugging face models;

Title: Software Engineer for AI Training Data (JavaScript/Swift)
Description:
Tech Stack

It does not matter which programming language is your primary and we accept engineers with JavaScript (however, you must be willing to work using Swift). Previous Swift experience is not required and we provide basic training.

Accepted Locations

We are accepting applicants from the US, Canada, and most countries in LATAM and Europe. We are accepting some countries in Africa and Asia. For the full list of accepted locations, click here. This work is 100% remote.

Loom Video

Our Founder/CEO, Gabe Greenberg, created a more in depth Loom video that we highly recommend you watch! Check it out here: https://www.loom.com/share/5a8972c7fbbf46aaa3f389b2b6391c40

Job Overview

We are currently seeking Developers for project-specific roles focused on RLHF. This role will play a key part in our reinforcement learning from human feedback (RLHF) initiatives, contributing to cutting-edge projects.

You‚Äôll join an expert annotation team to create training data for for the worlds most advanced AI models. No previous AI experience is necessary. You'll get your foot in the door with one of the biggest players in the AI/LLM space today. We are seeking software engineers with 4+ years of experience to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. We currently have 200+ roles open!

What Will I Be Doing?


Evaluating the quality of AI-generated code, including human-readable summaries of your rationale
Solve coding problems, writing functional and efficient code
Writing robust test cases to confirm code works efficiently and effectively
We asked the technical project manager to go into even more detail and this is how he answered: It is solving coding challenges, creating instructions to help others, reviewing the code before it goes into the model, and there's a ton of variety in the projects. We have everything from "which piece of Python code is better?" to "make a full mobile application using this chatbot, and improve the chatbot's responses afterwards to make it faster"


Contract Length


This project is expected to last until the end of September and you'll be able to continue to work on other projects (though likely not in Swift).
You can end the contract at any time.


Flexible Schedules


Developers can set their own hours - ideal candidates will be interested in spending 15+ hours a week. They will be with teams, so strong performers will adapt to the urgency of projects and stay engaged, but incredibly flexible on working hours.
Take a 3 hour lunch, no problem. You are paid according to time spent on the platform, which is calculated in the coding exercises, as opposed to tracking your own hours.


Compensation


US: $50 /hr
Brazil: $28.70/hr
Egypt: $22.05/hr
Phillipines: $25.55/hr
All other countries: $35/hr
Expectations are 15+ hours per week however there is no upper limit. We have engineers working 20-40 hrs per week and some that are working 40+ hours per week. You can work as much as you want to. You'll get paid on a weekly basis. You get paid per hour of work done on the platform.


Interview Process

We've created a 3.5 hour screening and onboarding process to join as a Software Engineer for AI Training Data which can be accomplished in 1 week or less. We purposely perform most of these steps asynchronously because most of the RLHF work is async and self guided. After you apply, if you look like a good fit we'll provide you access to the G2i dashboard to go through this simple screening process.

Step 1: Learn in depth about the role (35 min)

Step 2: Perform a simple RLHF code review (35 min)

Step 3: Receive platform credentials, pass ID verification (5 min), and choose your project (30 min).

Step 4: Perform a production level RLHF task (75 min) "aka the final interview"

Join us: Based on your final interview, you'll will put you on the right difficulty RLHF project

Title: Python Full Stack Developer
HTML:
Sede: Roma

Esperienza: Almeno 5 anni

Cosa aspettarti da questa posizione

Sarai inserito/a all‚Äôinterno della nostra Deda Next, azienda del Gruppo che offre alle Pubbliche Amministrazioni Centrali e Locali e alle Utilities, servizi e soluzioni per la trasformazione digitale, per la trasparenza e l‚Äôinteroperabilit√† dei dati, per la transizione ecologica ed una maggiore efficacia ed efficienza gestionale. Plus

Le Soft Skills Che Riteniamo Importanti

Title: Senior AI Engineer
Description:
SENIOR AI ENGINEER

Entra nel nostro mondo.

Trasforma insieme a noi.

Quale sar√† la tua sfida?

Il nostro team di Artificial Intelligence Engineering si impegna a supportare i clienti nel percorso di adozione dell‚Äôintelligenza artificiale attraverso la realizzazione di factory di soluzioni di AI, azionabili e integrate nell'architettura e nei processi aziendali.

La figura dell‚ÄôAI Engineer progetta soluzioni software di Machine Learning (ML) scalabili per i casi d'uso dei clienti e le industrializza per l‚Äôesecuzione in produzione garantendo i livelli richiesti di performance, sicurezza e governabilit√†.

L‚ÄôAI Engineer lavora a stretto contatto con altre figure di Bip xTech, come Cloud Data Architect, Data Scientist e Data Engineer, per realizzare soluzioni AI di alta qualit√† sotto ogni aspetto, disegnando e implementando: piattaforme MLOps, architetture dati e AI, modelli di AI, applicazioni e altro ancora.

L‚ÄôAI Engineer inoltre contribuir√† alla Bip xTech Data Community con attivit√† di ricerca, scouting tecnologico, concept di nuove soluzioni e sviluppo del business sui clienti di BIP.

Sarai tu a entrare nel nostro team?¬†

Requisiti fondamentali


Laurea specialistica in Ingegneria Informatica, Data Science, Informatica o discipline affini (STEM).
Esperienza pregressa di almeno 5 anni nello sviluppo di software in almeno un linguaggio, come per esempio: Python, Scala, e/o simili.
Esperienza nel disegno di soluzioni software e nell‚Äôimplementazione di strutture dati, algoritmi.
Esperienza nell‚Äôutilizzo degli strumenti di Code Repository e CI/CD.
Conoscenza di framework di versionamento di dati e/o modelli (esempio: MLFlow, DVC, WanDB‚Ä¶).
Conoscenza dei concetti, algoritmi e metodologie di Machine Learning e Gen AI.
Esperienza con linguaggi SQL per il design, query e gestione dei database; esperienza nell‚Äôutilizzo di linguaggi SQL per le attivit√† di ETL;
Esperienza in attivit√† di coordinamento e crescita di un team o pi√π team di progetto, pre-sales e delivery;
Indispensabile la conoscenza fluente di italiano e inglese professionali.


Plus


Esperienza nell‚Äôutilizzo delle principali piattaforme cloud (esempio: Google, AWS, Azure) e relativi servizi di Cloud Foundation, Data Platform e AI.
Esperienza con tecniche di allenamento e fine-tuning di reti neurali (esempio: superconvergenza, PEFT, LORA‚Ä¶).
Conoscenza di tecniche di semi-supervised e self-supervised learning.
Esperienza con framework di lavoro AGILE (esempio: Scrum, Kanban).


Soft Skills:


Standing consulenziale
Spiccate doti comunicative e interpersonali
Capacit√† di collaborazione in team
Flessibilit√† e stress tolerance nel rispetto delle scadenze
Disponibilit√† di trasferte in Italia o all‚Äôestero


Perch√® Bip?

People at¬†the¬†center of our culture

Fiducia e collaborazione, imprenditorialit√† e coraggio, meritocrazia e sviluppo guidano la crescita delle nostre persone.

Lavorare in BIP √® un'esperienza sfidante, in cui il merito paga e l'innovazione avviene attraverso idee coraggiose, collaborazione e un rapporto di fiducia con i nostri clienti.¬†

Challenge yourself

Avrai la possibilit√† di metterti alla prova in contesti progettuali diversi in termini di ambito, natura delle attivit√† e stakeholders coinvolti. Vedrai valorizzato il tuo spirito di iniziativa, la tua passione, l‚Äôautonomia e la capacit√† di assumerti responsabilit√† e metterti in gioco.

Unlocking your potential

Potrai partecipare a + di 300 corsi formativi all‚Äôavanguardia per accrescere le tue competenze su tecnologie e temi di business emergenti.

Work-life Integration

Troverai una policy che supporta lo smartworking¬†fino al 100% del proprio tempo e favorisce il work-life integration.

Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

Valorizziamo l‚Äôunicit√† e ci impegniamo a garantire che tutti abbiano pari opportunit√† di dare un contributo ed esprimere al massimo il potenziale nell'ambiente di lavoro.

Il nostro approccio alla diversit√† e all‚Äôinclusione si fonda sui principi di etica e integrit√† e rappresenta il fattore determinante per lo sviluppo di orizzonti, di crescita personale e aziendale, pi√π ampi.

Promuoviamo l‚Äôinserimento e l‚Äôintegrazione lavorativa delle persone appartenenti alle categorie protette ‚Äì in base a quanto disciplinato dalla legge 68/99 ‚Äì.

Next Steps

Una volta ricevuto il tuo cv ci prenderemo del tempo per valutarlo attentamente.

Se c‚Äô√® un match con questa o con altre posizioni aperte all‚Äôinterno del Gruppo, ti contatteremo per iniziare la nostra conoscenza reciproca.

In alternativa, saremo felici di conservare il tuo CV nel nostro database per poterlo rivalutare per altre opportunit√† future.

Se dovessi identificare ulteriori posizioni di tuo interesse ed in linea con il tuo profilo, aspettiamo la tua candidatura per poterla valutare nuovamente.

Su di Noi

Nati nel 2003, abbiamo raccolto e valorizzato l‚Äôesperienza storica della consulenza e abbiamo aggiunto due ingredienti chiave: l‚Äôinnovazione e la digitalizzazione.

Grazie a questo percorso siamo oggi oltre 5000 professionisti e professioniste, presenti in 13 Paesi, con oltre 4500 progetti alle spalle e le conoscenze pi√π all‚Äôavanguardia nell'ambito della Digital Transformation, Data Science, Cybersecurity, Industry 4.0, IOT e di tutte le Disruptive Technologies che mettiamo a servizio di ogni settore di mercato.

Aiutiamo i nostri clienti a fare la differenza creando qualit√† su larga scala attraverso una formula che opera su tre leve: Valore, Persone e Tecnologia.

Crediamo nel valore dell‚Äôeccellenza, che √® la bussola su cui orientiamo il nostro agire, e adottiamo un approccio etico e leale nei confronti di quante e quanti scelgono di¬†lavorare con noi, promuovendo un ambiente in cui le persone possano crescere insieme, grazie alla contaminazione tra competenze diverse.

Quale sar√† la tua sfida?

Il nostro team di Artificial Intelligence Engineering si impegna a supportare i clienti nel percorso di adozione dell‚Äôintelligenza artificiale attraverso la realizzazione di factory di soluzioni di AI, azionabili e integrate nell'architettura e nei processi aziendali.

La figura dell‚ÄôAI Engineer progetta soluzioni software di Machine Learning (ML) scalabili per i casi d'uso dei clienti e le industrializza per l‚Äôesecuzione in produzione garantendo i livelli richiesti di performance, sicurezza e governabilit√†.

L‚ÄôAI Engineer lavora a stretto contatto con altre figure di Bip xTech, come Cloud Data Architect, Data Scientist e Data Engineer, per realizzare soluzioni AI di alta qualit√† sotto ogni aspetto, disegnando e implementando: piattaforme MLOps, architetture dati e AI, modelli di AI, applicazioni e altro ancora.

L‚ÄôAI Engineer inoltre contribuir√† alla Bip xTech Data Community con attivit√† di ricerca, scouting tecnologico, concept di nuove soluzioni e sviluppo del business sui clienti di BIP.

Sarai tu a entrare nel nostro team? 

Requisiti fondamentali
  • Laurea specialistica in Ingegneria Informatica, Data Science, Informatica o discipline affini (STEM).
  • Esperienza pregressa di almeno 5 anni nello sviluppo di software in almeno un linguaggio, come per esempio: Python, Scala, e/o simili.
  • Esperienza nel disegno di soluzioni software e nell‚Äôimplementazione di strutture dati, algoritmi.
  • Esperienza nell‚Äôutilizzo degli strumenti di Code Repository e CI/CD.
  • Conoscenza di framework di versionamento di dati e/o modelli (esempio: MLFlow, DVC, WanDB‚Ä¶).
  • Conoscenza dei concetti, algoritmi e metodologie di Machine Learning e Gen AI.
  • Esperienza con linguaggi SQL per il design, query e gestione dei database; esperienza nell‚Äôutilizzo di linguaggi SQL per le attivit√† di ETL;
  • Esperienza in attivit√† di coordinamento e crescita di un team o pi√π team di progetto, pre-sales e delivery;
  • Indispensabile la conoscenza fluente di italiano e inglese professionali.


Plus
  • Esperienza nell‚Äôutilizzo delle principali piattaforme cloud (esempio: Google, AWS, Azure) e relativi servizi di Cloud Foundation, Data Platform e AI.
  • Esperienza con tecniche di allenamento e fine-tuning di reti neurali (esempio: superconvergenza, PEFT, LORA‚Ä¶).
  • Conoscenza di tecniche di semi-supervised e self-supervised learning.
  • Esperienza con framework di lavoro AGILE (esempio: Scrum, Kanban).


Soft Skills:
  • Standing consulenziale
  • Spiccate doti comunicative e interpersonali
  • Capacit√† di collaborazione in team
  • Flessibilit√† e stress tolerance nel rispetto delle scadenze
  • Disponibilit√† di trasferte in Italia o all‚Äôestero


Perch√® Bip?

People at the center of our culture

Fiducia e collaborazione, imprenditorialit√† e coraggio, meritocrazia e sviluppo guidano la crescita delle nostre persone.

Lavorare in BIP √® un'esperienza sfidante, in cui il merito paga e l'innovazione avviene attraverso idee coraggiose, collaborazione e un rapporto di fiducia con i nostri clienti. 

Challenge yourself

Avrai la possibilit√† di metterti alla prova in contesti progettuali diversi in termini di ambito, natura delle attivit√† e stakeholders coinvolti. Vedrai valorizzato il tuo spirito di iniziativa, la tua passione, l‚Äôautonomia e la capacit√† di assumerti responsabilit√† e metterti in gioco.

Unlocking your potential

Potrai partecipare a + di 300 corsi formativi all‚Äôavanguardia per accrescere le tue competenze su tecnologie e temi di business emergenti.

Work-life Integration

Troverai una policy che supporta lo smartworking fino al 100% del proprio tempo e favorisce il work-life integration.

Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

Valorizziamo l‚Äôunicit√† e ci impegniamo a garantire che tutti abbiano pari opportunit√† di dare un contributo ed esprimere al massimo il potenziale nell'ambiente di lavoro.

Il nostro approccio alla diversit√† e all‚Äôinclusione si fonda sui principi di etica e integrit√† e rappresenta il fattore determinante per lo sviluppo di orizzonti, di crescita personale e aziendale, pi√π ampi.

Promuoviamo l‚Äôinserimento e l‚Äôintegrazione lavorativa delle persone appartenenti alle categorie protette ‚Äì in base a quanto disciplinato dalla legge 68/99 ‚Äì.

Next Steps

Una volta ricevuto il tuo cv ci prenderemo del tempo per valutarlo attentamente.

Se c‚Äô√® un match con questa o con altre posizioni aperte all‚Äôinterno del Gruppo, ti contatteremo per iniziare la nostra conoscenza reciproca.

L‚Äôiter di selezione comprende generalmente un colloquio con HR, un colloquio tecnico con un line manager ed un eventuale colloquio con un Partner.

L‚Äôordine e il numero delle interviste potrebbero variare a seconda delle esigenze di recruiting.

In alternativa, saremo felici di conservare il tuo CV nel nostro database per poterlo rivalutare per altre opportunit√† future.

Se dovessi identificare ulteriori posizioni di tuo interesse ed in linea con il tuo profilo, aspettiamo la tua candidatura per poterla valutare nuovamente.

Su di Noi

Nati nel 2003, abbiamo raccolto e valorizzato l‚Äôesperienza storica della consulenza e abbiamo aggiunto due ingredienti chiave: l‚Äôinnovazione e la digitalizzazione.

Grazie a questo percorso siamo oggi oltre 5000 professionisti e professioniste, presenti in 13 Paesi, con oltre 4500 progetti alle spalle e le conoscenze pi√π all‚Äôavanguardia nell'ambito della Digital Transformation, Data Science, Cybersecurity, Industry 4.0, IOT e di tutte le Disruptive Technologies che mettiamo a servizio di ogni settore di mercato.

Aiutiamo i nostri clienti a fare la differenza creando qualit√† su larga scala attraverso una formula che opera su tre leve: Valore, Persone e Tecnologia.

Crediamo nel valore dell‚Äôeccellenza, che √® la bussola su cui orientiamo il nostro agire, e adottiamo un approccio etico e leale nei confronti di quante e quanti scelgono di lavorare con noi, promuovendo un ambiente in cui le persone possano crescere insieme, grazie alla contaminazione tra competenze diverse.

Supervisione/esecuzione dell'intero processo di autorizzazione fino allo stato di pronto per la costruzione, collaborazione con i Construction Manager fino al raggiungimento della data di operativit√† commerciale.

Title: Recent graduates in Management Engineering,informatics, STEM disciplines.
Description:
Would you like to direct your professional career towards the world of Management Consulting?

HSPI S.p.A, an IT consulting company active for over 20 years and part of the TXT Group, is the answer to your aspirations!

HSPI opens its doors to recent graduates in economics, management engineering, computer science, and scientific fields to become future IT Consultants.

HSPI offers its clients services in Business Consulting, IT Governance, and Digital Innovation.

If you have a theoretical understanding of these topics and wish to understand how they are applied in the world of work, send your application and you will have the opportunity to participate in an #Assessmentday session!

Upon successful completion of the selection process, you will have the opportunity to work with clients in the Roman territory and at the HSPI headquarters in Rome, engaging in one of the three pillars that make up HSPI and represent one of the following professional roles:


Project Management Consultant: Plans, manages, and monitors projects, ensuring the achievement of objectives within time and budget constraints.
IT Governance Consultant: Defines processes, policies, and procedures to ensure the achievement of corporate objectives through digital leverage.
Business Analyst: Analyzes business objectives and processes, identifying organizational and technological solutions for business innovation and improving corporate efficiency.
Data Scientist: Utilizes advanced data analysis techniques to extract knowledge and define strategies or make decisions.
Requirement Engineer: Explicitly negotiates and documents the requirements of IT solutions, ensuring they are clear, complete, and validated by stakeholders.
Cybersecurity Consultant: Identifies, analyzes, and mitigates risks to information security, developing and implementing strategies for data and IT service protection.
Compliance & ISO Consultant: Ensures company performance and compliance with regulations and international standards through the implementation of quality management systems.



What technical requirements should you have?


Master's degree in Management Engineering, Economics, Economics and Management, Computer Science, or STEM disciplines;
Excellent knowledge of the Office package (Excel, PowerPoint, Word);
Good knowledge of the English language.



What soft skills should you possess?


Excellent communication skills (both oral and written);
Teamworking ability;
Goal orientation, precision, and attention to detail.



Why choose HSPI?


Concrete experiences and on-the-job training: you will be immediately placed with clients of primary importance, constantly supported by Senior Consultants and Project Managers;
HSPI can provide certified training in various areas, customized based on your attitudes, skills, and knowledge;
Work mode with a high degree of autonomy and responsibility;
Young and dynamic environment within a rapidly growing and expanding international ecosystem;
Hybrid working mode with the possibility of Smart Working and flexible entry and exit times.



We anticipate an insertion with Extracurricular Internship or Apprenticeship contract, in line with your skills.

Apply and indicate in the presentation area the area of your greatest interest!

We look forward to seeing you at the next AssessmentDay!

#HSPI

Title: Senior AI Developer - Roma [DIG]
HTML:
Your Perspectives


Entra a far parte del nostro team Digital Innovation - AI Center of Excellence in rapida crescita e partecipa allo sviluppo di rivoluzionarie applicazioni basate su tecnologie di Intelligenza Artificiale. Avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di:


  • Sviluppare progetti basati su algoritmi di intelligenza artificiale, sia per ottimizzazioni dei processi interni o per clienti che integrati in innovative soluzioni software;
  • Contribuire attivamente alla crescita della nostra struttura dedicata all'Intelligenza Artificiale, in particolare al Natural Language Understanding e alla Computer Vision;
  • Partecipare al ciclo di vita di un prodotto basato su AI, dall‚Äôanalisi del business case, al tuning dei modelli, allo sviluppo delle componenti applicative richieste dall‚Äôapplicazione fino alla realizzazione della User Experience ideale;
  • Muoverti in un contesto organizzato, dove gli aspetti metodologici e di relazione assumono una rilevanza strategica con respiro internazionale e multiculturale;
  • Garantire l‚Äôerogazione dei deliverables di progetto concordati con il Project Manager di riferimento e con i committenti, in accordo con i vincoli di budget e quality condivisi;
  • Fornire supporto applicativo a soluzioni basate su moduli di Intelligenza Artificiale, Large Language Models e Computer Vision, sia esistenti che di nuova realizzazione.


Your unique strengths


  • Possiedi una laurea in discipline STEM e almeno un paio di anni di esperienza nel settore;
  • Hai esperienza nello sviluppo e addestramento di modelli utilizzando tecniche di Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing e Computer Vision, sia a partire dai framework pi√π utilizzati (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, Spark ML, Spark GraphX) che da servizi SaaS (Google Vertex AI, Azure Cognitive Services, OpenAI);
  • Hai almeno due anni di esperienza nell'utilizzo di Python per lo sviluppo di soluzioni basate su AI e sei interessato a lavorare con Large Language Models come OpenAI e nell‚Äôambito della Computer Vision (utilizzando strumenti di OCR e reti neurali come YoLo);
  • Hai basi di Semantic Web e conosci l‚Äôarchitettura dei motori di ricerca evoluti (Elastic Search, Solr, Lucene);
  • Hai utilizzato strutture dati NoSQL (MongoDB o componenti dell'ecosistema Hadoop);
  • Hai esperienza comprovata di utilizzo di linguaggi di programmazione object oriented come Java/Scala, C++ o Python;
  • Sei capace di mettere in pratica tecniche di "Continuous Learning" al fine di cogliere opportunit√† da nuove tecnologie senza abbandonarti alla sola attivit√† di ricerca;
  • Possiedi tecniche di ascolto attivo, capacit√† di sintesi e di problem solving;
  • Hai una sviluppata capacit√† di gestire progettualit√† in autonomia coordinando risorse pi√π junior ove necessario;
  • Ti contraddistingui per intraprendenza e curiosit√†, spiccato senso di responsabilit√† professionale;
  • Possiedi una conoscenza avanzata della lingua inglese (parlata e scritta).



Set your expectation higher

PwC ti sorprender√† con un‚Äôopportunit√† di carriera che ti far√† sentire al centro della societ√†, dell‚Äôinnovazione e del cambiamento. Il tuo talento e la tua curiosit√† avranno tutto lo spazio che meritano e, attraverso l‚Äôidentificazione delle migliori risorse, contribuirai a garantire la qualit√† dei servizi che offriamo ai nostri clienti. In questo percorso di crescita sarai accompagnato da colleghi esperti e da una formazione continua e su misura grazie alla quale potrai mettere le tue competenze a disposizione dei clienti interni.


Feel at home

Ci prendiamo cura delle nostre persone, abbracciando le diversit√† e creando valore per i clienti, le persone e la comunit√†, nel rispetto dell'ambiente. GIVE YOUR LIFE A DIFFERENT PERSPECTIVE

Title: Cercasi Sviluppatore Software per Lezioni di Programmazione
HTML:
Letuelezioni, portale leader per fare lezioni private in Italia, cerca sviluppatori software per lezioni di programmazione.

Se sei un informatico, ti piacerebbe insegnare ed hai bisogno di entrate extra per le tue spese, registrati gratuitamente sulla nostra piattaforma per trovare i tuoi studenti sin dal primo giorno!

Compiti

  • Prepara un programma specifico per aiutare l'apprendimento dello studente;
  • Comincia a dare lezioni private da subito;
  • Seriet√†, puntualit√† e professionalit√† con gli studenti.

Requisiti

  • Non √® richiesta esperienza;
  • Diploma di Maturit√†, programmatore e sviluppatore informatico;
  • Passione per l'insegnamento e l'informatica.

Vantaggi

  • Dai lezioni private a centinaia di studenti;
  • Registrati gratuitamente;
  • Impartisci lezioni online o a domicilio;
  • Decidi tu quanto guadagnare a lezione;
  • Nessuna commissione;

Title: Developer Full-Stack (m/f/x)
Description:

Title: Nutrition Analyst (Data Science)
Description:
DEADLINE FOR APPLICATIONS

28 August 2024-23:59-GMT+01:00 Central European Time (Rome)

WFP celebrates and embraces diversity. It is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all its employees and encourages qualified candidates to apply irrespective of race, colour, national origin, ethnic or social background, genetic information, gender, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, religion or belief, HIV status or disability.

Are you interested in further developing your professional experience while contributing to ending global hunger? Are you passionate about helping those in need? Would you like to join a global organization investing in its people?

If so, an exciting & fulfilling career awaits you!!! Join our diverse and passionate team that works on varied and international projects directly contributing to saving & changing millions of lives around the globe.

About Wfp

The United Nations World Food Programme (WFP), a highly prestigious, reputable & world‚Äôs largest humanitarian organization, saving lives in emergencies and using food assistance to build a pathway to peace, stability and prosperity for people recovering from conflict, disasters and the impact of climate change.

At WFP, people are at the heart of everything we do and the vision of the future WFP workforce is one of diverse, committed, skilled, and high performing teams, selected on merit, operating in a healthy and inclusive work environment, living WFP's values (Integrity, Collaboration, Commitment, Humanity, and Inclusion) and working with partners to save and change the lives of those WFP serves.

To learn more about WFP, visit our website: https://www.wfp.org and follow us on social media to keep up with our latest news: YouTube, LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter.

WHY JOIN WFP?


WFP is a 2020 Nobel Peace Prize Laureate.
WFP offers a highly inclusive, diverse, and multicultural working environment.
WFP invests in the personal & professional development of its employees through a range of training, accreditation, coaching, mentorship, and other programs as well as through internal mobility opportunities.
A career path in WFP provides an exciting opportunity to work across the various country, regional and global offices around the world, and with passionate colleagues who work tirelessly to ensure that effective humanitarian assistance reaches millions of people across the globe.
We offer an attractive compensation package (please refer to the Terms and Conditions section of this vacancy announcement).


Background And Purpose Of The Assignment

The UN World Food Programme (WFP) is one of the leading global institutions helping to measure and alleviate malnutrition. WFP supports national food and health systems across more than 80 countries as they strive to provide access, safely and systematically, to healthy, nutritious diets and reduce micronutrient deficiencies in women, children and the population at large. A key part of this work is the generation of data on food and nutrition security and status, dietary diversity and access to nutritious foods and nutritious diets, including food costs and expenditure, and using these data to highlight where there are risks of insufficiencies, by target group, geography or vulnerability, reflected as hunger (insufficient dietary energy and coping strategies), unaffordability of nutrient-adequate diets, inadequate dietary diversity, risk of inadequate micronutrient intake and likelihood of micronutrient deficiencies.

When households, and specific household members, are unable to meet their dietary micronutrient needs due to physical, financial or sociological barriers, it becomes necessary to consider additional pathways that can safeguard against micronutrient malnutrition. Large-Scale Food Fortification (LSFF) is a powerful, cost-effective intervention for improving micronutrient intake that can be adapted to many food vehicles and contexts and delivered through different platforms, including both conventional commercial markets and food assistance, including school meals and social protection programs. WFP has long been involved in efforts to expand the scope and impact of LSFF.

Advocacy and decision making about LSFF and other micronutrient intervention programmes and policy, especially about whether, where, what, how and for whom to advocate for and implement such initiatives, require evidence. This includes information on micronutrient deficiencies and dietary intake for different populations, the likelihood that current diets are able to meet the recommended requirements for key vitamins and minerals and current intake of fortifiable foods among specific sub-groups of the population. They also require information about the extent to which different LSFF programmes, programme delivery scenarios, and other micronutrient interventions could assist in filling nutrient intake gaps for key populations. Such evidence is imperative to inform decisions across the LSFF ecosystem, including policy formulation, setting standards and determining whether LSFF is having an impact, in general, and with particular emphasis on those who are most vulnerable, with a focus on gender. However, due to cost, time needed and complexity of primary data collection on vitamin and mineral deficiency (VMD) and dietary intake, there are still many gaps in data needed to quantify the problem, e.g., magnitude and distribution of micronutrient malnutrition and nutrient inadequacy, as well as food consumption patterns within a population, required for proper program design and exploration of new cost-effective vehicles and entry points for fortification. Further, existing data or methods of obtaining data are limited in their ability to describe dimensions of intake inadequacy related to vulnerability in terms of gender, age, geography, biological status and illness.

The WFP specialises in uses of innovative data approaches to support governments make informed decisions about the design and effective implementation of food security and nutrition policy and programs, including the integration of nutrition objectives across food systems - to achieve maximum impact. WFP‚Äôs HungerMapLive is widely-used to inform humanitarian programming and food security situation monitoring. HungerMapLive displays real-time information on food insecurity, nutrition and various relevant drivers using primary data collected using remote monitoring, estimates generated using machine learning-based predictive analytics and publicly available secondary data pulled automatically through APIs. The use of innovative methods to use existing data to estimate or predict the risk of dietary vitamin and mineral deficiencies and the potential of different programs, including LSFF, to fill nutrient gaps can support programme and policy decision-makers from national governments and other stakeholders. This activity brings together the analytical and government technical assistance expertise of the Nutrition and Food Quality Service, and data collection and visualisation experience from the HungerMapLive Team.

About The Team

WFP‚Äôs Modelling and Mapping risk of Inadequate Micronutrient Intake (MIMI) approach generates and increases access to modeled data on risk of inadequate micronutrient intake at national and sub-national levels, which is critical to advocate for and inform the design and roll-out of large-scale food fortification as well as other micronutrient interventions and complementary programs.

Specifically, MIMI works with academic and policy partners to develop innovative methods for modelling the risk of inadequate dietary micronutrient intake and the extent to which large scale food fortification (LSFF) (of different commodities and fortified according to different specifications) could reduce risk, to inform policy decision-making and advocacy. MIMI‚Äôs estimated and predictive analytical models use secondary data on food supply, food consumption and expenditure, socioeconomic status and climate, among others, and allow exploration of nutritional vulnerability by geography, gender and socioeconomic characteristics. To date, methods have been validated against dietary consumption and micronutrient status data in three countries. The outputs have been developed into inputs to display on interactive sub-national maps, with the support of WFP‚Äôs Hunger MapLive Team. Importantly, the team are engaging with stakeholders in each of the focus geographies to support and document the application, validation and uptake of modelled evidence to inform policy and advocacy and document the process. The initiative overall has benefited from WFP‚Äôs in-country presence and partnerships with the relevant academic and civil society partners, among other stakeholders, to promote transparency, provide a forum for discussion, maximize stakeholder involvement at the global-level, incorporate the views of potential end users at the country level and build community acceptance.

Between 2024 and 2026, MIMI will expand evidence generation and stakeholder engagement activities to an additional eight countries and explore the potential of integrating WFP‚Äôs real-time data monitoring into the modelling and analysis. The advertised position reflects work to be undertaken under this new phase.

Purpose Of The Assignment

The Nutrition Analyst (Data Science) will play a critical role in the MIMI team, within the WFP Nutrition and Food Quality Service. Under the supervision of the MIMI Team Lead, and working as part of a dynamic, multidisciplinary team of nutritionists, data scientists, policy and advocacy specialists, this position will contribute to the development and application of analytical methods, data analysis and data visualization, and engage meaningfully and present outputs to diverse stakeholders at the country- and global-level. The Nutrition Analyst will bring knowledge in statistics or data science and technical expertise in the analysis, modelling and visualization of nutrition and food consumption or expenditure data, especially data from Household Consumption and Expenditure Surveys to estimate food and nutrient intake and inform LSFF and other nutrition programmes and policy. The Nutrition Analyst will also have a role in building systems to access diverse data across multiple country contexts, maintaining code management infrastructure and methods documentation, and developing guidance for users of these outputs.

Accountabilities/Responsibilities


Map and explore data and indicators relevant to the estimation of the risk of dietary micronutrient inadequacy
Collate, clean and process national survey datasets for 3-6 countries.
Work collaboratively with team members, and analytical partners to refine and test methods to estimate the risk of inadequate micronutrient intake and conduct analysis for 3-6 countries.
Contribute to thought leadership on the development and application of analytical models to test the potential contribution of fortification and other micronutrient interventions to reducing risk of inadequate micronutrient intake.
Build robust and secure data systems to streamline access to multiple diverse data types from several country contexts
Develop code management infrastructure with clearly documented indices and guidance notes for team members and future users.
Engage with, present specific analytical methods and findings to and participate in technical-level discussions with analytical partners and stakeholders at the global-level and in diverse countries.
Support the development of evidence outputs and data visualisations based on user feedback, including preparing outputs for the HungerMapLive.
Prepare and participate in dissemination and policy implementation activities to in-country stakeholders, led by WFP Country Offices.
Prepare for and provide training and other capacity strengthening activities on the methods developed and use of household consumption data to estimate micronutrient risk, as relevant.
Lead or contribute to the drafting of academic manuscripts for submission to peer-reviewed journals.
Participate in field missions to focus countries and WFP country offices, as required.
Presentation at academic webinars or conferences, as relevant.


Deliverables At The End Of The Contract


Analysis of data inputs from 1-3 countries to estimate risk of inadequate intake of individual micronutrients and micronutrients overall.
Intervention modelling for 1-3 countries to estimate the contribution of different micronutrient interventions to reducing the risk of inadequate micronutrient intake.
Data inputs for visualisation on the HungerMapLive platform for at least three countries.
Relevant analysis, synthesis and thematic presentations and publications developed.
Relevant and useful GitHub repository and data infrastructure developed.
Presentation of methodology and results to diverse stakeholders nationally and internationally.
Development of peer-reviewed articles, topic briefs and other external-facing materials as required to present methodology, analysis and validation of results.


Education

QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:


Masters degree or higher in Data Science, Epidemiology, Medical Statistics or a related field.


Experience


3-4 years work experience, some of that on informing health or nutrition programmes a plus.
Experience supporting research projects or analyses with diverse stakeholders and data inputs, including research design, data analysis and write up.
Familiarity cleaning, merging and processing large, complex datasets, ideally Household Consumption and Expenditure Surveys.
Experience analysing primary and secondary data.
Experience with version control systems (Git) and relevant collaboration tools (issue trackers, shared repositories, etc.)
Experience presenting analysis findings to diverse audiences, including government stakeholders, programme staff and academic partners, in a digestible and context-relevant format.
Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a team environment, especially with colleagues from diverse backgrounds.


Knowledge & Skills


Proficient in the analysis of large quantitative data sets using R statistical software
Analytical and problem-solving skills, with a strong solution and action orientation.
Flexibility, sound interpersonal skills and cross-cultural sensitivity.


Languages


Advanced professional level of written and spoken English
Professional knowledge of French an asset.


WFP LEADERSHIP FRAMEWORK

WFP Leadership Framework guides to the common standards of behavior that guide HOW we work together to accomplish our mission.

Click here to access WFP Leadership Framework

REASONABLE ACCOMMODATION

WFP is dedicated to fostering diversity, equity, and inclusion. Our recruitment process is inclusively crafted to welcome candidates of all backgrounds, celebrating diversity and ensuring a respectful environment for all. We aim for an accessible and fair recruitment journey. Should you need any reasonable accommodations or have accessibility concerns, please reach out to us confidentially at global.inclusion@wfp.org. Our DEI team is here to ensure your full participation in our recruitment process.

NO FEE DISCLAIMER

The United Nations does not charge any application, processing, training, interviewing, testing or other fee in connection with the application or recruitment process. Should you receive a solicitation for the payment of a fee, please disregard it. Furthermore, please note that emblems, logos, names and addresses are easily copied and reproduced. Therefore, you are advised to apply particular care when submitting personal information on the web.

REMINDERS BEFORE YOU SUBMIT YOUR APPLICATION


We strongly recommend that your profile is accurate, complete, and includes your employment records, academic qualifications, language skills and UN Grade (if applicable).
Once your profile is completed, please apply, and submit your application.
Please make sure you upload your professional CV in the English language
Kindly note the only documents you will need to submit at this time are your CV and Cover Letter
Additional documents such as passport, recommendation letters, academic certificates, etc. may potentially be requested at a future time
Please contact us at wfprecruitment@wfp.org in case you face any challenges with submitting your application
Only shortlisted candidates will be notified


All employment decisions are made on the basis of organizational needs, job requirements, merit, and individual qualifications. WFP is committed to providing an inclusive work environment free of sexual exploitation and abuse, all forms of discrimination, any kind of harassment, sexual harassment, and abuse of authority. Therefore, all selected candidates will undergo rigorous reference and background checks.

No appointment under any kind of contract will be offered to members of the UN Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions (ACABQ), International Civil Service Commission (ICSC), FAO Finance Committee, WFP External Auditor, WFP Audit Committee, Joint Inspection Unit (JIU) and other similar bodies within the United Nations system with oversight responsibilities over WFP, both during their service and within three years of ceasing that service.
